life.author: Chinua Achebe

life.quote: The damage done in one year can sometimes take ten or twenty years to repair.
life.author: Chinua Achebe

life.quote: The greatest threat to freedom is the absence of criticism.
life.author: Wole Soyinka

life.quote: Don't take shadows too seriously. Reality is your only safety. Continue to reject illusion.
life.author: Wole Soyinka

life.quote: Only 4 sets of people can vote for the PDP: (1) those who are intellectually blind; (2) those who are blinded by ethnicity; (3) those who are blinded by corruption and therefore afraid of the unknown, should power change hands; and finally (4) those who are suffering from a combination of the above terminal sicknesses.
life.author: Wole Soyinka

life.quote: Be yourself. Ultimately just be yourself.
life.author: Wole Soyinka

life.quote: As long as one people sit on another and are deaf to their cry, so long will understanding and peace elude all of us.
life.author: Chinua Achebe

life.quote: If you don't like someones story, write your own.
life.author: Chinua Achebe

life.quote: A man who pays respect to the great paves the way for his own greatness
life.author: Chinua Achebe

life.quote: A goat does not eat into a hen's stomach no matter how friendly the two may be.
life.author: Chinua Achebe

life.quote: The impatient idealist says: 'Give me a place to stand and I shall move the earth.' But such a place does not exist. We all have to stand on the earth itself and go with her at her pace.
life.author: Chinua Achebe

life.quote: There is a moral obligation, I think, not to ally oneself with power against the powerless.
life.author: Chinua Achebe

life.quote: The realization of New Africa can only be possible by the African cultivating spiritual balance, which leads to the practicalization of social regeneration, to realizing economic determination, becoming mentally emancipated, and ushering in a political resurgence.
life.author: Nnamdi Azikiwe

life.quote: Originality is the essence of true scholarship. Creativity is the soul of the true scholar.
life.author: Nnamdi Azikiwe

life.quote: Looking at faces of people, one gets the feeling there's a lot of work to be done.
life.author: Wole Soyinka

life.quote: There is no story that is not true.
life.author: Chinua Achebe

life.quote: The sun will shine on those who stand before it shines on those who kneel under them.
life.author: Chinua Achebe

life.quote: People go to Africa and confirm what they already have in their heads and so they fail to see what is there in front of them. This is what people have come to expect. Its not viewed as a serious continent. Its a place of strange, bizarre and illogical things, where people dont do what common sense demands.
life.author: Chinua Achebe

life.quote: I cannot accept the definition of collective good as articulated by a privileged minority in society, especially when that minority is in power.
life.author: Wole Soyinka

life.quote: But theater, because of its nature, both text, images, multimedia effects, has a wider base of communication with an audience. That's why I call it the most social of the various art forms.
life.author: Wole Soyinka

life.quote: All these boundaries - Africa, Asia, Malaysia, America - are set by men. But you don't have to look at boundaries when you are looking at a man - at the character of a man. The question is: What do you stand for? Are you a follower, or are you a leader?
life.author: Hakeem Olajuwon

life.quote: I am convinced that Nigeria would have been a more highly developed country without the oil. I wished we'd never smelled the fumes of petroleum.
life.author: Wole Soyinka

life.quote: The writer is the visionary of his people... He anticipates, he warns.
life.author: Wole Soyinka

life.quote: Vatican II declares the Church... as necessary for salvation.
life.author: Francis Arinze

life.quote: A man of worth never gets up to unsay what he said yesterday.
life.author: Chinua Achebe

life.quote: I remember at the 1996 Olympics in Atlanta, Shaq always wanted me to show him steps over and over.
life.author: Hakeem Olajuwon

life.quote: My stiffest earthly assignment is ended and my major life's work is done. My country is now free and I have been honoured to be its first indigenous head of state. What more could one desire in life?
life.author: Nnamdi Azikiwe

life.quote: Femi Fani Kayode is my boy. Provide him food, he will eat and then sing for you. He’s a smart boy
life.author: Olusegun Obasanjo

life.quote: If you deceive me once shame on you because I have trusted you once and you have deceived me, if you deceive me twice shame on me because I have learnt my lessons and you have deceive me and if you deceive me for the third time shame on me because am a compound fool.
life.author: Olusegun Obasanjo

life.quote: No matter how old an individual may be, no matter if he is young or old, if he thinks in accordance with the times he is immortal.
life.author: Nnamdi Azikiwe

life.quote: Literature doesn't have a country. Shakespeare is an African writer. His Falstaff, for example, is very African in his appetite for life, his largeness of spirit. The characters of Turgenev are ghetto dwellers. Dickens characters are Nigerians.
life.author: Ben Okri

life.quote: Given the scale of trauma caused by the genocide, Rwanda has indicated that however thin the hope of a community can be, a hero always emerges. Although no one can dare claim that it is now a perfect state, and that no more work is needed, Rwanda has risen from the ashes as a model or truth and reconciliation.
life.author: Wole Soyinka

life.quote: When suffering knocks at your door and you say there is no seat for him, he tells you not to worry because he has brought his own stool.
life.author: Chinua Achebe

life.quote: You might as well say that the woman lies on top of the man when they are making the babies.
life.author: Chinua Achebe

life.quote: Intolerance has become, I think, the reigning ideology of the world today, the intolerance versus intolerance and it's taken on lethal proportions.
life.author: Wole Soyinka

life.quote: People say human nature is a very vague expression, people tend to say human nature is corruptible anyway and it comes from a theological point of view, goes back to the Garden of Eden, that there is always this corrupt gene waiting to be activated that we inherited from the very beginning. I don't believe in that theological excuse.
life.author: Wole Soyinka

life.quote: The hardships that I encountered in the past will help me succeed in the future.
life.author: Philip Emeagwali

life.quote: A people are as healthy and confident as the stories they tell themselves. Sick storytellers can make nations sick. Without stories we would go mad. Life would lose it’s moorings or orientation... Stories can conquer fear, you know. They can make the heart larger.
life.author: Ben Okri

life.quote: To poison a nation, poison its stories. A demoralised nation tells demoralised stories to itself. Beware of the storytellers who are not fully conscious of the importance of their gifts, and who are irresponsible in the application of their art: they
life.author: Ben Okri

life.quote: I will not say the fact that there are no European Union observers at an election means that it will not be fair and free.
life.author: Olusegun Obasanjo

life.quote: Debate and divergence of views can only enrich our history and culture.
life.author: Ibrahim Babangida

life.quote: We have fallen into this very mean description of humanity. Naturalism in fiction is too reductive in its definition of human beings.
life.author: Ben Okri

life.quote: I always value my large kitchen because it was better to do everything there, you wash up, you do everything, rather than messing up another room and I pop my typewriter just next to it. So I still write now but I was doing more writing when the children were younger.
life.author: Buchi Emecheta

life.quote: ...when we are comfortable and inattentive, we run the risk of committing grave injustices absentmindedly.
life.author: Chinua Achebe

life.quote: While we do our good works let us not forget that the real solution lies in a world in which charity will have become unnecessary.
life.author: Chinua Achebe

life.quote: The road will never swallow you. The river of destiny will always overcome evil. May you understand your fate. Suffering will never destroy you, but will make you stronger. Success will never confuse you of scatter your spirit, but will make you fly higher into the good sunlight. Your life will always surprise you.
life.author: Ben Okri

life.quote: The first great thing is to find yourself and for that you need solitude and contemplation - at least sometimes. I can tell you deliverance will not come from the rushing noisy centers of civilization. It will come from the lonely places.
life.author: Fridtjof Nansen

life.quote: The difficult is what takes a little time; the impossible is what takes a little longer.
life.author: Fridtjof Nansen

life.quote: It is better to go skiing and think of God, than go to church and think of sport.
life.author: Fridtjof Nansen

life.quote: I demolish my bridges behind me - then there is no choice but forward.
life.author: Fridtjof Nansen

life.quote: Love is life's snow. It falls deepest and softest into the gashes left by the fight - whiter and purer than snow itself.
life.author: Fridtjof Nansen

life.quote: The history of the human race is a continual struggle from darkness into light. It is, therefore, to no purpose to discuss the use of knowledge; man wants to know, and when he ceases to do so, is no longer a man.
life.author: Fridtjof Nansen

life.quote: If you have good thoughts they will shine out of your face like sunbeams and you will always look lovely.
life.author: Roald Amundsen

life.quote: The strongest man in the world is he who stands most alone.
life.author: Henrik Ibsen

life.quote: A thousand words will not leave so deep an impression as one deed.
life.author: Henrik Ibsen

life.quote: Happiness is the struggle towards a summit and, when it is attained, it is happiness to glimpse new summits on the other side.
life.author: Fridtjof Nansen

life.quote: You are one with your skis and nature. This is something that develops not only the body but the soul as well, and it has a deeper meaning for a people than most of us perceive.
life.author: Fridtjof Nansen

life.quote: Victory awaits him, who has everything in order - luck we call it. Defeat is definitely due for him, who has neglected to take the necessary precautions - bad luck we call it
life.author: Roald Amundsen

life.quote: The whole plan of extermination was nothing less than a cold blooded, calculated political measure, having for its object the annihilation of a superior element in the population, which might prove troublesome, and to this must be added the motive of greed.
life.author: Fridtjof Nansen

life.quote: The sea possesses a power over one's moods that has the effect of a will. The sea can hypnotize. Nature in general can do so.
life.author: Henrik Ibsen

life.quote: It is not by spectacular achievements that man can be transformed, but by will.
life.author: Henrik Ibsen

life.quote: Borders I have never seen one. But I have heard they exist in the minds of some people.
life.author: Thor Heyerdahl

life.quote: We must always remember with gratitude and admiration the first sailors who steered their vessels through storms and mists, and increased our knowledge of the lands of ice in the South.
life.author: Roald Amundsen

life.quote: Man wants to know, and when he ceases to do so, he is no longer a man.
life.author: Fridtjof Nansen

life.quote: Never keep a line of retreat: it is a wretched invention.
life.author: Fridtjof Nansen

life.quote: Sustainable development is development that meets the needs of the present without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own needs.
life.author: Gro Harlem Brundtland

life.quote: One man practicing sportsmanship is far better than a hundred teaching it.
life.author: Knute Rockne

life.quote: A community is like a ship; everyone ought to be prepared to take the helm.
life.author: Henrik Ibsen

life.quote: Contaminated food is a major cause of diarrhea, substantially contributing to malnutrition and killing about 2.2 million people each year, most of them children.
life.author: Gro Harlem Brundtland

life.quote: The secret is to work less as individuals and more as a team. As a coach, I play not my eleven best, but my best eleven.
life.author: Knute Rockne

life.quote: I think now, we in the international community are belatedly wanting to show our solidarity with the Somali peoples and also do our best to help them move to better times.
life.author: Jan Egeland

life.quote: Build up your weaknesses until they become your strong points.
life.author: Knute Rockne

life.quote: The only qualifications for a lineman are to be big and dumb. To be a back, you only have to be dumb.
life.author: Knute Rockne

life.quote: We need better coordination on the international side, just as they need better and more effective efforts on the Somali side. We have too many reconstruction and development assistance plans.
life.author: Jan Egeland

life.quote: From my rotting body, flowers shall grow and I am in them and that is eternity.
life.author: Edvard Munch

life.quote: I have seen this happen in recent years with regard to pharmaceuticals and vaccines, where, working together, we are improving access to medicines and vaccines for infectious diseases in the poorest countries.
life.author: Gro Harlem Brundtland

life.quote: To have the ability to withdraw into oneself and forget everything around one when one is creating - What, I think is the only requirement for being able to bring forth something beautiful. The whole thing is - a mystery.
life.author: Edvard Grieg

life.quote: Victory awaits him who has everything in order - luck, people call it.
life.author: Roald Amundsen

life.quote: One of the things I like about my profession, and that I find healthy, is that one constantly has to break oneself to pieces.
life.author: Liv Ullmann

life.quote: I think the biggest challenge for Somalia has been the sense that it is a hopeless case of incomprehensible internal conflicts and there is nothing we can do.
life.author: Jan Egeland

life.quote: It is inexcusable for scientists to torture animals; let them make their experiments on journalists and politicians.
life.author: Henrik Ibsen

life.quote: What is art? Art grows from joy and sorrow, but mostly from sorrow. It grows from human lives.
life.author: Edvard Munch

life.quote: My fear of life is necessary to me, as is my illness. Without anxiety and illness, I am a ship without a rudder. My art is grounded in reflections over being different from others. My sufferings are part of my self and my art. They are indistinguishable from me, and their destruction would destroy my art. I want to keep those sufferings
life.author: Edvard Munch

life.quote: Finally, I also come in recognition of the great work that has been undertaken by the NGOs and UN agencies that have been active for many years here, especially through the local staff and international staff here in Somaliland and in Somalia at large.
life.author: Jan Egeland

life.quote: Finally, I am encouraged to note that the Security Council issued a statement today expressing its concern about the massive humanitarian crisis in Darfur and calling on all parties to the conflict to protect civilians and reach a ceasefire.
life.author: Jan Egeland

life.quote: We estimate that humanitarian agencies have access to about 350,000 vulnerable people in Darfur - only about one third of the estimated total population in need.
life.author: Jan Egeland

life.quote: If winning isn't everything why bother to keep the score?
life.author: Knute Rockne

life.quote: A forest bird never wants a cage.
life.author: Henrik Ibsen

life.quote: We receive reports now on a daily basis from our own people on the ground in Darfur on widespread atrocities and grave violations of human rights against the civilian population.
life.author: Jan Egeland

life.quote: When we are young, friends are, like everything else, a matter of course. In the old days we know what it means to have them.
life.author: Edvard Grieg

life.quote: In old age we are like a batch of letters that someone has sent. We are no longer in the past, we have arrived.
life.author: Knut Hamsun

life.quote: The majority is always wrong; the minority is rarely right.
life.author: Henrik Ibsen

life.quote: Although we have do not have adequate access to all parts of Darfur we do fortunately have humanitarian personnel, including staff from my own office, in each of the three provincial capitals of Darfur.
life.author: Jan Egeland

life.quote: The viewers must come to understand the sacredness of painting, so they will remove their hats as if they were in church.
life.author: Edvard Munch

life.quote: There is a battle that goes on between men and women. Many people call it love.
life.author: Edvard Munch

life.quote: All art, literature, and music must be born in your heart's blood. Art is your heart's blood.
life.author: Edvard Munch

life.quote: The reason why I hated school so intensely [was that] it interfered with my freedom.
life.author: Sigrid Undset

life.quote: Prosperity or egalitarianism -- you have to choose. I favor freedom -- you never achieve real equality anyway: you simply sacrifice prosperity for an illusion.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: Like writing, reading is a protest against the insufficiencies of life.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: The secret to happiness, at least to peace of mind, is knowing how to separate sex from love. And, if possible, eliminating romantic love from your life, which is the love that makes you suffer. That way, I assure you, you live with greater tranquility and enjoy things more.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: Life is a shitstorm, in which art is our only umbrella." (spoken by character in a novel by Mario Vargas Llosa)
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: There are people with a lot of prejudice, a lot of fear of the unknown. They think that immigration is a danger, when really it is a solution. This is an interesting issue, because it will be a central question of our time.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: The secret to a masterpiece is 10 percent inspiration and 90 percent perspiration.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: You cannot teach creativity - how to become a good writer. But you can help a young writer discover within himself what kind of writer he would like to be.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: ‎Reading good literature is an experience of pleasure...but it is also an experience of learning what and how we are, in our human integrity and our human imperfection, with our actions, our dreams, and our ghosts, alone and in relationships that link us to others, in our public image and in the secret recesses of our consciousness.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: Its easy to know what you want to say, but not to say it
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: We either make ourselves miserable, or we make ourselves strong. The amount of work is the same.
life.author: Carlos Castenada

life.quote: No matter how ephemeral it is, a novel is something, while despair is nothing.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: Literature is a form of permanent insurrection. Its mission is to arouse, to disturb, to alarm, to keep men in a constant state of dissatisfaction with themselves.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: I learned to read at the age of five, in Brother Justiniano's class at the De la Salle Academy in Cochabamba, Bolivia. It is the most important thing that has ever happened to me. Almost seventy years later I remember clearly how the magic of translating the words in books into images enriched my life, breaking the barriers of time and space.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: Revolution will free society of its afflictions, while science will free the individual of his.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: There is an incompatibility between literary creation and political activity.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: Once upon a time, there was a boy who learned to read at the age of 5. This changed his life. Owing to the adventure tales he read, he discovered a way to escape from the poor house, the poor country, and the poor reality in which he lived.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: Maintain democracy or go to dictatorship: that is what is at stake in these elections.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: I am a free man. I feel as light as a feather.
life.author: Javier Perez De Cuellar

life.quote: Writing a book is a very lonely business. You are totally cut off from the rest of the world, submerged in your obsessions and memories.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: The aim of political institutions like the United Nations is to draw the line between struggle and conflict and to make it possible for nations to stay on the right side of that line.
life.author: Javier Perez De Cuellar

life.quote: A good novel is a conjunction of many factors, the main of which is without a doubt, hard work.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: It isn't true that convicts live like animals: animals have more room to move around.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: I am like a doctor. I have written a prescription to help the patient. If the patient doesn't want all the pills I've recommended, that's up to him. But I must warn that next time I will have to come as a surgeon with a knife.
life.author: Javier Perez De Cuellar

life.quote: The worst thing that can happen to an artist is to be subsidized by the state. It leads to an intellectual and artistic castration.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: Do the rhetorical quarrels of bourgeois political parties have anything to do with the interests of the humble and downtrodden?
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: We must mistrust utopias: they usually end in holocausts.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: You can't do a machine without knowing something about how it's going to work. As for the romantics, the costumes bored me and I don't enjoy doing period clothes.
life.author: Boris Vallejo

life.quote: Even though what I enjoy most is literature, I would not want to live only in a world of fiction, cut off from the rest of life. No - I want to always have a foot in the street, to be inmersed in the activities of my contemporaries, in the times, in the place where I live.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: We were trained as writers with the idea that literature is something that can change reality, that it's not just a very sophisticated entertainment, but a way to act.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: Science is still only a candle glimmering in a great pitch-dark cavern.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: There have been many different artists that have been inspirational. I suppose the question is directed to what was the reason why I went into fantasy illustration.
life.author: Boris Vallejo

life.quote: I find that acrylics dry very fast - which is supposed to be its charm; however, I find that because of that quality they don't blend as nicely as the oils. The oils, for one thing, are softer and more flexible than the acrylics. Also, the colors are brighter with oils.
life.author: Boris Vallejo

life.quote: If you are killed because you are a writer, that's the maximum expression of respect, you know.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: There are many things behind a good novel, but in particular there is a lot of work - a lot of patience, a lot of stubbornness, and a critical spirit.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: Reading was such an enrichment of my life. And it was that pleasure that I had as a very young reader probably that is the origin of my vocation.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: I have a chest full of all the insults, villainies, and infamies a man is capable of withstanding. . . . If you become famous, you will have to go through that.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: I was very young and lived with my grandparents in a villa with white walls in the Calle Ocharan, in Miraflores.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: No democracy is born perfect, and none ever gets to be perfect. Yet democracy is superior to authoritarian and totalitarian regimes because, unlike them, democracy is perfectible.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: The truths that seem most truthful, if you look at them from all sides, if you look at them close up, turn out to be either half truths or lies.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: Prosperity or egalitarianism - you have to choose. I favor freedom - you never achieve real equality anyway: you simply sacrifice prosperity for an illusion.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: A man of knowledge chooses a path with a heart and follows it and then he looks and rejoices and laughs and then he sees and knows.
life.author: Carlos Castenada

life.quote: Memory is a snare, pure and simple; it alters, it subtly rearranges the past to fit the present.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: Writers are the exorcists of their own demons.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: It is rare and almost impossible for a novel to have only one narrator.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: But what do I have? The things I'm told and the things I tell, that's all. And as far as I know, that never yet made anyone fly.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: One can't fight with oneself, for this battle has only one loser.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: That is one thing I am sure of amid my many uncertainties regarding the literary vocation: deep inside, a writer feels that writing is the best thing that ever happened to him, or could ever happen to him, because as far as he is concerned, writing is the best possible way of life, never mind the social, political, or financial rewards of what he might achieve through it.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: I always write a draft version of the novel in which I try to develop, not the story, not the plot, but the possibilities of the plot. I write without thinking much, trying to overcome all kinds of self-criticism, without stopping, without giving any consideration to the style or structure of the novel, only putting down on paper everything that can be used as raw material, very crude material for later development in the story.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: The writer’s job is to write with rigor, with commitment, to defend what they believe with all the talent they have. I think that’s part of the moral obligation of a writer, which cannot be only purely artistic. I think a writer has some kind of responsibility at least to participate in the civic debate. I think literature is impoverished, if it becomes cut from the main agenda of people, of society, of life.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: Death isn't enough. It doesn't remove the stain. But a slap, a whiplash, square on the face, does. Because a man's face is as sacred as his mother or his wife.
life.author: Mario Vargas Llosa

life.quote: Dreams are not what you see in your sleep, dreams are things which do not let you sleep.
life.author: Cristiano Ronaldo

life.quote: The value of things is not the time they last, but the intensity with which they occur. That is why there are unforgettable moments and unique people!
life.author: Fernando Pessoa

life.quote: Life is what we make of it. Travel is the traveler. What we see isn't what we see but what we are.
life.author: Fernando Pessoa

life.quote: Your love makes me strong, Your hate makes me unstoppable".
life.author: Cristiano Ronaldo

life.quote: My soul is a hidden orchestra; I know not what instruments, what fiddlestrings and harps, drums and tamboura I sound and clash inside myself. All I hear is the symphony.
life.author: Fernando Pessoa

life.quote: The slope takes you to the windmill, but effort takes you nowhere.
life.author: Fernando Pessoa

life.quote: We never love anyone. What we love is the idea we have of someone. It's our own concept—our own selves—that we love.
life.author: Fernando Pessoa

life.quote: Everything interests me, but nothing holds me.
life.author: Fernando Pessoa

life.quote: I am nothing. I'll never be anything. I couldn't want to be something. Apart from that, I have in me all the dreams in the world.
life.author: Fernando Pessoa

life.quote: Inside us there is something that has no name, that something is what we are.
life.author: Jose Saramago

life.quote: Mesut Ozil made me the worlds best striker
life.author: Cristiano Ronaldo

life.quote: I bear the wounds of all the battles I avoided.
life.author: Fernando Pessoa

life.quote: I’ve dreamed a lot. I’m tired now from dreaming but not tired of dreaming. No one tires of dreaming, because to dream is to forget, and forgetting does not weigh on us, it is a dreamless sleep throughout which we remain awake. In dreams I have achieved everything.
life.author: Fernando Pessoa

life.quote: I wasn’t meant for reality, but life came and found me.
life.author: Fernando Pessoa

life.quote: Without football, my life is worth nothing.
life.author: Cristiano Ronaldo

life.quote: He does things I have never seen from any other player and it really is marvellous to watch. It takes a great player to grab the bull by the horns and make things happen, but he has done it repeatedly. He has been even better than people here thought he would be and that's saying something.
life.author: Cristiano Ronaldo

life.quote: The world is governed by institutions that are not democratic - the World Bank, the IMF, the WTO.
life.author: Jose Saramago

life.quote: I don't say we are a defensive team. I say we are a strong team in defensive terms, but at the same time lacking sufficient fluidity in attack because that will take time to come.
life.author: Jose Mourinho

life.quote: I've always rejected being understood. To be understood is to prostitute oneself. I prefer to be taken seriously for what I'm not, remaining humanly unknown, with naturalness and all due respect
life.author: Fernando Pessoa

life.quote: I think we are blind, Blind but seeing, Blind people who can see, but do not see.
life.author: Jose Saramago

life.quote: We worship perfection because we can't have it; if we had it, we would reject it. Perfection is inhuman, because humanity is imperfect.
life.author: Fernando Pessoa

life.quote: There is a time when it is necessary to abandon the used clothes, which already have the shape of our body and to forget our paths, which takes us always to the same places. This is the time to cross the river: and if we don't dare to do it, we will have stayed, forever beneath ourselves
life.author: Fernando Pessoa

life.quote: The best way to stop Messi is when you play with 11 men and then you can double mark him, one player to stay on him and the other to help out. If it is 11 against 10 then you have almost no chance of stopping him.
life.author: Jose Mourinho

life.quote: I'm ready to lose my life if that's what Portugal needs to win. I'll play vs USA even if I play with one leg.
life.author: Cristiano Ronaldo

life.quote: I'm proud to play for Real Madrid because I have fun; when you no longer have fun it's a sign that it's time to leave. For now though, I'm happy here at the greatest club in the world.
life.author: Cristiano Ronaldo

life.quote: There are ships sailing to many ports, but not a single one goes where life is not painful.
life.author: Fernando Pessoa

life.quote: Being tired of all illusions and of everything about illusions – the loss of illusions, the uselessness of having them, the prefatigue of having to have them in order to lose them, the sadness of having had them, the intellectual shame of having had them knowing that they would have to end this way.
life.author: Fernando Pessoa

life.quote: Literature is the most agreeable way of ignoring life.
life.author: Fernando Pessoa

life.quote: To me, being the best means proving it in different countries and championships.
life.author: Cristiano Ronaldo

life.quote: Everything around me is evaporating. My whole life, my memories, my imagination and its contents, my personality - it's all evaporating. I continuously feel that I was someone else, that I felt something else, that I thought something else. What I'm attending here is a show with another set. And the show I'm attending is myself.
life.author: Fernando Pessoa

life.quote: The kid makes you sick. He looks the part, he walks the part, he is the part. He's six-foot something, fit as a flea, good-looking - he's got to have something wrong with him....Hopefully he's hung like a hamster! That would make us all feel better!
life.author: Cristiano Ronaldo

life.quote: Have you ever considered, beloved other, how invisible we are to each other? We look at each other without seeing. We listen to each other and hear only a voice inside out self. The words of others are mistakes of our hearing, shipwrecks of our understanding. How confidently we believe OUR meanings of other people's words.
life.author: Fernando Pessoa

life.quote: You have to work hard AND well. There are a lot of people who work hard but not well.
life.author: Jose Mourinho

life.quote: People live with the illusion that we have a democratic system, but it's only the outward form of one. In reality we live in a plutocracy, a government of the rich.
life.author: Jose Saramago

life.quote: The high point of my career was winning the Champions League. No one will ever erase that from my memory, in the same way that no one will ever erase the fact that I did it in a Manchester United shirt.
life.author: Cristiano Ronaldo

life.quote: The novel is not so much a literary genre, but a literary space, like a sea that is filled by many rivers.
life.author: Jose Saramago

life.quote: The title race is between two horses and a little horse that needs milk and needs to learn how to jump.
life.author: Jose Mourinho

life.quote: Arsenal have won that advantage, nobody gave it to them. By playing fantastic football and by winning matches and by winning trophies, they won that respect that the opponent has for them.
life.author: Jose Mourinho

life.quote: It is like having a blanket that is too small for the bed, you pull the blanket up to keep your chest warm, and your feet stick out. I cannot buy a bigger blanket because the supermarket is closed. But the blanket I have is made of cashmere. So it's good.
life.author: Jose Mourinho

life.quote: I have a fantastic wife, and not only in terms of external beauty. Her priority and mine is our children. That is our choice.
life.author: Luis Figo

life.quote: The U.S. needs to control the Middle East, the gateway to Asia. It already has military installations in Uzbekistan.
life.author: Jose Saramago

life.quote: I suffer from life and from other people. I can’t look at reality face to face. Even the sun discourages and depresses me. Only at night and all alone, withdrawn, forgotten and lost, with no connection to anything real or useful — only then do I find myself and feel comforted.
life.author: Fernando Pessoa

life.quote: I say 20 words in English. I say money, money, money, and I say hot dog! I say yes, no and I say money, money, money and I say turkey sandwich and I say grape juice.
life.author: Carmen Miranda

life.quote: I'd woken up early, and I took a long time getting ready to exist.
life.author: Fernando Pessoa

life.quote: Football is a more beautiful game in high definition.
life.author: Jose Mourinho

life.quote: The worst pain ... isn't the pain you feel at the time, it's the pain you feel later on when there's nothing you can do about it, They say that time heals all wounds, But we never live long enough to test that theory.
life.author: Jose Saramago

life.quote: I believe that you should gravitate to people who are doing productive and positive things with their lives.
life.author: Nadia Comaneci

life.quote: You should also appreciate the goodness around you, and surround yourself with positive people.
life.author: Nadia Comaneci

life.quote: There is no other world. Nor even this one. What, then, is there? The inner smile provoked in us by the patent nonexistence of both.
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: I don't run away from a challenge because I am afraid. Instead, I run toward it because the only way to escape fear is to trample it beneath your feet.
life.author: Nadia Comaneci

life.quote: I imagine a future aircraft, which will take off vertically, fly as usual, and land vertically. This flying machine should have no moving parts. This idea came from the huge power of cyclones.
life.author: Henri Coanda

life.quote: Do I look like someone who has something to do here on earth?' —That's what I'd like to answer the busybodies who inquire into my activities.
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: I ended up in the US for a month or so, before moving to Montreal with some Romanian friends.
life.author: Nadia Comaneci

life.quote: By all evidence we are in the world to do nothing.
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: You are done for - a living dead man - not when you stop loving but stop hating. Hatred preserves: in it, in its chemistry, resides the mystery of life.
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: Only truthful hands write true poems. I cannot see any basic difference between a handshake and a poem.
life.author: Paul Celan

life.quote: My marriage to my husband, Bart Conner in 1996 is my proudest personal moment.
life.author: Nadia Comaneci

life.quote: The aphorism is cultivated only by those who have known fear in the midst of words, that fear of collapsing with all the words.
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: Don't run from a challenge. Instead run toward it, because the only way to escape fear is to trample it beneath your feet.
life.author: Nadia Comaneci

life.quote: Of course, I grew up in Communist Romania, but I am happy to say that now our country is democratic, and prospering, since the revolution in 1989.
life.author: Nadia Comaneci

life.quote: One of the most difficult times in my life was when I escaped from Romania in November of 1989.
life.author: Nadia Comaneci

life.quote: You cannot be anything if you want to be everything.
life.author: Solomon Schechter

life.quote: Paradise was unendurable, otherwise the first man would have adapted to it; this world is no less so, since here we regret paradise or anticipate another one. What to do? Where to go? Do nothing and go nowhere, easy enough.
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: I haven't reported my missing credit card to the police because whoever stole it is spending less than my wife.
life.author: Ilie Nastase

life.quote: The multiplication of our kind borders on the obscene; the duty to love them, on the preposterous.
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: Only optimists commit suicide, optimists who no longer succeed at being optimists. The others, having no reason to live, why would they have any to die?
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: When you fall, leap to your feet and try again.
life.author: Nadia Comaneci

life.quote: Chaos is rejecting all you have learned, chaos is being yourself.
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: Jump off the beam, flip off the bars follows your dreams, and reach for the stars
life.author: Nadia Comaneci

life.quote: Better to be an animal than a man, an insect than an animal, a plant than an insect, and so on. Salvation? Whatever diminishes the kingdom of consciousness and compromises its supremacy.
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: Death makes no sense except to people who have passionately loved life. How can one die without having something to part from? Detachment is a negation of both life and death. Whoever has overcome his fear of death has also triumphed over life. For life is nothing but another word for this fear.
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: If you have confidence you have patience. Confidence, that is everything.
life.author: Ilie Nastase

life.quote: Ideas should be neutral. But man animates them with his passions and folly. Impure and turned into beliefs, they take on the appearance of reality. The passage from logic is consummated. Thus are born ideologies, doctrines, and bloody farce.
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: Life creates itself in delirium and is undone in ennui.
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: Reality is not simply there, it does not simply exist: it must be sought out and won.
life.author: Paul Celan

life.quote: Hard work has made it easy. That is my secret. That is why I win.
life.author: Nadia Comaneci

life.quote: The need for novelty is the characteristic of an alienated gorilla.
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: The poem is lonely. It is lonely and en route. Its author stays with it. Does this very fact not place the poem already here, at its inception, in the encounter, in the mystery of encounter?
life.author: Paul Celan

life.quote: Poetry is a sort of homecoming.
life.author: Paul Celan

life.quote: Don't sign your name between worlds, surmount the manifold of meanings, trust the tearstain, learn to live.
life.author: Paul Celan

life.quote: I hoped to win a medal and hoped it would be gold. I knew I was good but didn't know I would be the one to score something that had never been done before.
life.author: Nadia Comaneci

life.quote: Ennui is the echo in us of time tearing itself apart.
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: The sole means of protecting your solitude is to offend everyone, beginning with those you love.
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: I would like to explode, flow, crumble into dust, and my disintegration would be my masterpiece.
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: To accomplish nothing and die of the strain
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: History is nothing but a procession of false Absolutes, a series of temples raised to pretexts, a degradation of the mind before the Improbable.
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: In a republic, that paradise of debility, the politician is a petty tyrant who obeys the laws.
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: No one recovers from the disease of being born, a deadly wound if there ever was one.
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: Democracy: a festival of mediocrity.
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: To live... in any sense of the word... is to reject others; to accept them, one must renounce, do oneself violence.
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: German poetry is going in a very different direction from French poetry.... Its language has become more sober, more factual. It distrusts "beauty." It tries to be truthful.
life.author: Paul Celan

life.quote: Not to be born is undoubtedly the best plan of all. Unfortunately, it is within no one's reach.
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: I never met one interesting mind that was not richly endowed with inadmissible deficiencies.
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: There is no such thing as several Romanias, but only politicians who divide Romania depending on the interests of their parties and their clout.
life.author: Traian Basescu

life.quote: With wine and being lost, with less and less of both: I rode through the snow, do you read me I rode God far--I rode God near, he sang, it was our last ride over the hurdled humans. They cowered when they heard us overhead, they wrote, they lied our neighing into one of their image-ridden languages.
life.author: Paul Celan

life.quote: It is because we are all impostors that we endure each other. The man who does not consent to lie will see the earth shrink under his feet: we are biologically obliged to the false
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: Hungarian Language — savage it may be but of a beauty that has nothing human about it, with sonorities of another universe, powerful and corrosive, appropriate to prayer, to groans and to tears, risen out of hell to perpetuate its accent and its aura…words of nectar and cyanide.
life.author: Emile M. Cioran

life.quote: Light-enchanted sunflower, thouWho gazest ever true and tenderOn the sun's revolving splendour.
life.author: Pedro Calderon de la Barca

life.quote: You must sacrifice every thought, every ideology for the good of the nation and for the serenity of our fatherhood.
life.author: Francisco Franco

life.quote: One thing that I am sure of, and which I can answer truthfully, is that whatever the contingencies that may arise here, wherever I am there will be no communism.
life.author: Francisco Franco

life.quote: Color in certain places has the great value of making the outlines and structural planes seem more energetic.
life.author: Antoni Gaudi

life.quote: Those who look for the laws of Nature as a support for their new works collaborate with the creator.
life.author: Antoni Gaudi

life.quote: The first step in the acquisition of wisdom is silence, the second listening, the third memory, the fourth practice, the fifth teaching others.
life.author: Solomon Ibn Gabirol

life.quote: Have no fear of perfection. You'll never reach it.
life.author: Salvador Dali

life.quote: We each decide whether to make ourselves learned or ignorant, compassionate or cruel, generous or miserly. No one forces us. No one decides for us, no one drags us along one path or the other. We are responsible for what we are.
life.author: Maimonides

life.quote: Why do you try to understand art? Do you try to understand the song of a bird?
life.author: Pablo Picasso

life.quote: The guitar is the easiest instrument to play and the hardest to play well.
life.author: Andres Segovia

life.quote: Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.
life.author: Pablo Picasso

life.quote: The meaning of life is to find your gift. The purpose of life is to give it away.
life.author: Pablo Picasso

life.quote: He who loses wealth loses much; he who loses a friend loses more; but he that loses his courage loses all.
life.author: Miguel de Cervantes

life.quote: A true artist is not one who is inspired, but one who ispires others.
life.author: Salvador Dali

life.quote: To burn with desire and keep quiet about it is the greatest punishment we can bring on ourselves.
life.author: Federico Garcia Lorca

life.quote: Everything you can imagine is real.
life.author: Pablo Picasso

life.quote: The physician should not treat the disease but the patient who is suffering from it
life.author: Maimonides

life.quote: Let us be under no illusion. The Jewish spirit, which was responsible for the alliance of large-scale capital with Marxism and was the driving force behind so many anti-Spanish revolutionary agreements, will not be got rid of in a day.
life.author: Francisco Franco

life.quote: It is not hard to obey when we love the one whom we obey.
life.author: Saint Ignatius

life.quote: Learn the rules like a pro, so you can break them like an artist.
life.author: Pablo Picasso

life.quote: Never stand begging for that which you have the power to earn.
life.author: Miguel de Cervantes

life.quote: Every man should view himself as equally balanced: half good and half evil. Likewise, he should see the entire world as half good and half evil.... With a single good deed he will tip the scales for himself, and for the entire world, to the side of good.
life.author: Maimonides

life.quote: Teach thy tongue to say 'I do not know,' and thou shalt progress.
life.author: Maimonides

life.quote: Do not consider it proof just because it is written in books, for a liar who will deceive with his tongue will not hesitate to do the same with his pen.
life.author: Maimonides

life.quote: A true artist is not one who is inspired, but one who inspires others.
life.author: Salvador Dali

life.quote: The whole secret of the campaigns unleashed against Spain can be explained in two words: Masonry and Communism... we have to extirpate these two evils from our land.
life.author: Francisco Franco

life.quote: Let nothing which can be treated by diet be treated by other means.
life.author: Maimonides

life.quote: Only put off until tomorrow what you are willing to die having left undone.
life.author: Pablo Picasso

life.quote: Action is the foundational key to all success.
life.author: Pablo Picasso

life.quote: Teach us to give and not to count the cost.
life.author: Saint Ignatius

life.quote: Never stand begging for that which you have the power to earn.
life.author: Miguel de Cervantes

life.quote: Only put off until tomorrow what you are willing to die having left undone.
life.author: Pablo Picasso

life.quote: It should not be believed that all beings exist for the sake of the existence of man. On the contrary, all the other beings too have been intended for their own sakes and not for the sake of anything else.
life.author: Maimonides

life.quote: Some painters transform the sun into a yellow spot, others transform a yellow spot into the sun.
life.author: Pablo Picasso

life.quote: Each morning when I awake, I experience again a supreme pleasure - that of being Salvador Dali.
life.author: Salvador Dali

life.quote: God who preceded all existence is a refuge.
life.author: Maimonides

life.quote: The wise man does at once what the fool does finally.
life.author: Baltasar Gracian

life.quote: Great wine requires a mad man to grow the vine, a wise man to watch over it, a lucid poet to make it, and a lover to drink it.
life.author: Salvador Dali

life.quote: The day that hunger is eradicated from the earth there will be the greatest spiritual explosion the world has ever known. Humanity cannot imagine the joy that will burst into the world.
life.author: Federico Garcia Lorca

life.quote: No masterpiece was ever created by a lazy artist.
life.author: Salvador Dali

life.quote: The risk of a wrong decision is preferable to the terror of indecision.
life.author: Maimonides

life.quote: Have no fear of perfection - you'll never reach it.
life.author: Salvador Dali

life.quote: The phoenix hope, can wing her way through the desert skies, and still defying fortune's spite; revive from ashes and rise.
life.author: Miguel de Cervantes

life.quote: There are some days when I think I'm going to die from an overdose of satisfaction.
life.author: Salvador Dali

life.quote: One day it will have to be officially admitted that what we have christened reality is an even greater illusion than the world of dreams.
life.author: Salvador Dali

life.quote: Art is the best possible introduction to the culture of the world. I love it for the buried hopes, the garnered memories, the tender feelings it can summon at a touch. It washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.
life.author: Pablo Picasso

life.quote: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.
life.author: Pablo Picasso

life.quote: A wise man gets more use from his enemies than a fool from his friends.
life.author: Baltasar Gracian

life.quote: He who loses wealth loses much. He who loses a friend loses more. But he who loses courage loses all.
life.author: Miguel de Cervantes

life.quote: Surrealism is destructive, but it destroys only what it considers to be shackles limiting our vision.
life.author: Salvador Dali

life.quote: Mistakes are almost always of a sacred nature. Never try to correct them. On the contrary: rationalize them, understand them thoroughly. After that, it will be possible for you to sublimate them.
life.author: Salvador Dali

life.quote: In order to attain the impossible, one must attempt the absurd.
life.author: Miguel de Cervantes

life.quote: Never permit a dichotomy to rule your life, a dichotomy in which you hate what you do so you can have pleasure in your spare time. Look for a situation in which your work will give you as much happiness as your spare time.
life.author: Pablo Picasso

life.quote: You can look at a picture for a week and never think of it again. You can also look at the picture for a second and think of it all your life.
life.author: Joan Miro

life.quote: Intelligence is quickness in seeing things as they are.
life.author: George Santayana

life.quote: Those who cannot remember the pastare condemned to repeat it. or: Those who have never heard of good system development practice are condemned to reinvent it.
life.author: George Santayana

life.quote: There will be no communism.
life.author: Francisco Franco

life.quote: The principle goal of education in the schools should be creating men and women who are capable of doing new things, not simply repeating what other generations have done.
life.author: Jean Piaget

life.quote: The man who promises everything is sure to fulfil nothing, and everyone who promises too much is in danger of using evil means in order to carry out his promises, and is already on the road to perdition.
life.author: Carl Jung

life.quote: Don’t hold on to someone who’s leaving, otherwise you won’t meet the one who’s coming.
life.author: Carl Jung

life.quote: Are we forming children who are only capable of learning what is already known? Or should we try to develop creative and innovative minds, capable of discovery from the preschool age on, throughout life?
life.author: Jean Piaget

life.quote: Women wish to be loved not because they are pretty, or good, or well bred, or graceful, or intelligent, but because they are themselves.
life.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

life.quote: Thinking is difficult, that’s why most people judge.
life.author: Carl Jung

life.quote: Thinking is difficult, that's why most people judge.
life.author: Carl Jung

life.quote: Space and light and order. Those are the things that men need just as much as they need bread or a place to sleep.
life.author: Le Corbusier

life.quote: Architecture is the learned game, correct and magnificent, of forms assembled in the light.
life.author: Le Corbusier

life.quote: Children have real understanding only of that which they invent themselves, and each time that we try to teach them too quickly, we keep them from reinventing it themselves.
life.author: Jean Piaget

life.quote: Education, for most people, means trying to lead the child to resemble the typical adult of his society . . . but for me and no one else, education means making creators. . . . You have to make inventors, innovators...not conformists
life.author: Jean Piaget

life.quote: Light creates ambience and feel of a place, as well as the expression of a structure.
life.author: Le Corbusier

life.quote: What we need is a cup of understanding, a barrel of love, and an ocean of patience.
life.author: Saint Francis de Sales

life.quote: Loneliness does not come from having no people around you, but from being unable to communicate the things that seen important to you.
life.author: Carl Jung

life.quote: Intelligence is what you use when you don't know what to do.
life.author: Jean Piaget

life.quote: The materials of city planning are: sky, space, trees, steel and cement; in that order and that hierarchy.
life.author: Le Corbusier

life.quote: Half an hour's meditation each day is essential, except when you are busy. Then a full hour is needed.
life.author: Saint Francis de Sales

life.quote: Great occasions for serving God come seldom, but little ones surround us daily.
life.author: Saint Francis de Sales

life.quote: Knowing your own darkness is the best method for dealing with the darknesses of other people.
life.author: Carl Jung

life.quote: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.
life.author: Carl Jung

life.quote: I am not what has happened to me. I am what I choose to become.
life.author: Carl Jung

life.quote: I prefer drawing to talking. Drawing is faster, and leaves less room for lies.
life.author: Le Corbusier

life.quote: Chairs are architecture, sofas are bourgeois.
life.author: Le Corbusier

life.quote: A house is a machine for living in.
life.author: Le Corbusier

life.quote: Anxiety is the greatest evil that can befall a soul, except sin. God commands you to pray, but He forbids you to worry.
life.author: Saint Francis de Sales

life.quote: If our religion is based on salvation, our chief emotions will be fear and trembling. If our religion is based on wonder, our chief emotion will be gratitude.
life.author: Carl Jung

life.quote: Life never stops. The torment of men will be eternal, unless the function of creating and acting and changing, living intensely through each day, be considered an eternal joy.
life.author: Le Corbusier

life.quote: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.
life.author: Carl Jung

life.quote: Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.
life.author: Carl Jung

life.quote: The difference between a good life and a bad life is how well you walk through the fire
life.author: Carl Jung

life.quote: To create architecture is to put in order. Put what in order? Function and objects.
life.author: Le Corbusier

life.quote: The city of Chandigarh is planned to human scale. It puts us in touch with the infinite cosmos and nature. It provides us with places and buildings for all human activities by which the citizens can live a full and harmonious life. Here the radiance of nature and heart are within our reach.
life.author: Le Corbusier

life.quote: The meeting of two personalities is like the contact of two chemical substances: if there is any reaction, both are transformed.
life.author: Carl Jung

life.quote: VOCATUS ATQUE NON VOCATUS DEUS ADERIT.
life.author: Carl Jung

life.quote: The shoe that fits one person, pinches another; there is no recipe for living that suits all cases.
life.author: Carl Jung

life.quote: There are always four sides to a story: your side, their side, the truth and what really happened.
life.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

life.quote: I have made a pact with my tongue, not to speak when my heart is disturbed.
life.author: Saint Francis de Sales

life.quote: God takes pleasure to see you take your little steps; and like a good father who holds his child by the hand, He will accommodate His steps to yours and will be content to go no faster than you. Why do you worry?
life.author: Saint Francis de Sales

life.quote: What is desired is that the teacher ceased being a lecturer, satisfied with transmitting ready-made solutions. His role should rather be that of a mentor stimulating initiative and research.
life.author: Jean Piaget

life.quote: Have patience with all things, But, first of all with yourself.
life.author: Saint Francis de Sales

life.quote: The brighter the light, the darker the shadow.
life.author: Carl Jung

life.quote: To be normal is the ideal aim of the unsuccessful.
life.author: Carl Jung

life.quote: Plants are shaped by cultivation and men by education. .. We are born weak, we need strength; we are born totally unprovided, we need aid; we are born stupid, we need judgment. Everything we do not have at our birth and which we need when we are grown is given us by education.
life.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

life.quote: It is with children that we have the best chance of studying the development of logical knowledge, mathematical knowledge, physical knowledge, and so forth.
life.author: Jean Piaget

life.quote: People who know little are usually great talkers, while men who know much say little.
life.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

life.quote: The home should be the treasure chest of living.
life.author: Le Corbusier

life.quote: Until you make the unconscious conscious, it will direct your life and you will call it fate.
life.author: Carl Jung

life.quote: Only education is capable of saving our societies from possible collapse, whether violent, or gradual.
life.author: Jean Piaget

life.quote: If you die trying, you die winning.
life.author: Roger Federer

life.quote: Be grateful for your difficulties and challenges, for they hold blessings. In fact... Man needs difficulties; they are necessary for health personal growth, individuation and self-actualisation.
life.author: Carl Jung

life.quote: We shall steer safely through every storm, so long as our heart is right, our intention fervent, our courage steadfast, and our trust fixed on God. If at times we are somewhat stunned by the tempest, never fear. Let us take breath, and go on afresh.
life.author: Saint Francis de Sales

life.quote: During the earliest stages the child perceives things like a solipsist who is unaware of himself as subject and is familiar only with his own actions.
life.author: Jean Piaget

life.quote: Evolution of mankind is paralleled by the increase and expansion of consciousness.
life.author: Albert Hofmann

life.quote: Filling the conscious mind with ideal conceptions is a characteristic of Western theosophy, but not the confrontation with the Shadow and the world of darkness. One does not become enlightened by imagining figures of light, but by making the darkness conscious. The latter procedure, however, is disagreeable and therefore not popular.
life.author: Carl Jung

life.quote: Genius is personal, decided by fate, but it expresses itself by means of system. There is no work of art without system.
life.author: Le Corbusier

life.quote: Patience is bitter, but its fruit is sweet.
life.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

life.quote: Go to the meadows, go to the garden, go to the woods. Open your eyes!
life.author: Albert Hofmann

life.quote: We cannot change anything until we accept it. Condemnation does not liberate, it oppresses.
life.author: Carl Jung

life.quote: We will win the battle for Africa, which is in effect a battle for Humanity.
life.author: Abdoulaye Wade

life.quote: Democracy is constructed like an edifice, freedom by freedom, right by right, until it reaches its snapping point.
life.author: Abdoulaye Wade

life.quote: We therefore must keep the faith, despite the defeat of policies, because men pass with their policies whilst generations follow each other.
life.author: Abdoulaye Wade

life.quote: Europe is not one of the major powers. And Africa even less so of course. But Africa has what Europe lacks: space, human resources, and natural resources while Europe has the technological innovation that Africa lacks. Together we can become a power which can count in the future.
life.author: Abdoulaye Wade

life.quote: A small child from a developing country has the advantage, from a very early age, of having access to toys which structure his mind, which constitute a sure advantage over the little African child who has never even held a modern toy.
life.author: Abdoulaye Wade

life.quote: I support the state, but not the state-run economy. The state should intervene only to create the conditions necessary for the private sector to thrive.
life.author: Abdoulaye Wade

life.quote: Education for all seems to be the product of a type of distributive justice that is in no way related to the individual.
life.author: Abdoulaye Wade

life.quote: I am counting on the private sector, because it is crucial to Senegal's future.
life.author: Abdoulaye Wade

life.quote: We wish to ensure that young Africans do not feel disorientated in the century in which they live.
life.author: Abdoulaye Wade

life.quote: The teacher that I was for decades, and that I still am in a certain way, wondered what was meant by the word education. I was truly dumbfounded at the very thought of dealing with such an essential and extensive subject.
life.author: Abdoulaye Wade

life.quote: I am poor and naked, but I am the chief of the nation. We do not want riches but we do want to train our children right. Riches would do us no good. We could not take them with us to the other world. We do not want riches. We want peace and love.
life.author: Red Cloud

life.quote: We were told that they wished merely to pass through our country. . . to seek for gold in the far west . . . Yet before the ashes of the council are cold, the Great Father is building his forts among us. . . . His presence here is . . . an insult to the spirits of our ancestors. Are we then to give up their sacred graves to be allowed for corn?
life.author: Red Cloud

life.quote: Western civilization, unfortunately, does not link knowledge and morality but rather, it connects knowledge and power and makes them equivalent.
life.author: Vine Deloria, Jr.

life.quote: I hope the Great Heavenly Father, who will look down upon us, will give all the tribes his blessing, that we may go forth in peace, and live in peace all our days, and that He will look down upon our children and finally lift us far above this earth.
life.author: Red Cloud

life.quote: Look at me. I was a warrior on this land where the sun rises, now I come from where the sun sets. Whose voice was first surrounded on this land - the red people with bows and arrows. The Great Father says he is good and kind to us. I can't see it.
life.author: Red Cloud

life.quote: We do not want riches, we want peace and love.
life.author: Red Cloud

life.quote: Religion is for people who are afraid of going to hell. Spirituality is for those who have already been there.
life.author: Vine Deloria, Jr.

life.quote: The Great Spirit will not make me suffer because I am ignorant. He will put me in a place where I shall be better off than in this world.
life.author: Red Cloud

life.quote: You whites make all the ammunition.
life.author: Red Cloud

life.quote: They made us many promises, more than I can remember, but they never kept but one; they promised to take our land, and they took it.
life.author: Red Cloud

life.quote: The white man has got the gold out of the land which belonged to the red man.
life.author: Red Cloud

life.quote: The whites are the same everywhere. I see them every day.
life.author: Red Cloud

life.quote: The whites, who are educated and civilized, swindle me, and I am not hard to swindle because I do not know how to read and write.
life.author: Red Cloud

life.quote: When I was a young man, I was poor. In a war with other nations, I was in eighty-seven fights. There I received my name and was made Chief of my nation. But now I am old and am for peace.
life.author: Red Cloud

life.quote: When asked by an anthropologist what the Indians called America before the white man came, an Indian said simply, "Ours."
life.author: Vine Deloria, Jr.

life.quote: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: It is better to die for an idea that will live, than to live for an idea that will die.
life.author: Steven Biko

life.quote: Everyone can rise above their circumstances and achieve success if they are dedicated to and passionate about what they do.
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: Live life as though nobody is watching, and express yourself as though everyone is listening.
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: If the ANC does to you what the apartheid government did to you, then you must do to the ANC what you did to the apartheid government.
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: Forgiveness liberates the soul. It removes fear. That is why it is such a powerful weapon.
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: I am not a saint, unless you think of a saint as a sinner who keeps on trying.
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: It is so easy to break down and destroy.The heroes are those who make peace andbuild.
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: Lead from the back — and let others believe they are in front.
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: The most potent weapon of the oppressor is the mind of the oppressed.
life.author: Steven Biko

life.quote: I am an African. I owe my being to the hills and the valleys, the mountains and the glades, the rivers, the deserts, the trees, the flowers, the seas and the ever-changing seasons that define the face of our native land.
life.author: Thabo Mbeki

life.quote: Gloom and despondency have never defeated adversity. Trying times need courage and resilience. Our strength as a people is not tested during the best of times.
life.author: Thabo Mbeki

life.quote: Being black is not a matter of pigmentation - being black is a reflection of a mental attitude.
life.author: Steven Biko

life.quote: Do not judge me by my successes, judge me by how many times I fell down and got back up again.
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: A winner is a dreamer who never gives up
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: The basic tenet of black consciousness is that the black man must reject all value systems that seek to make him a foreigner in the country of his birth and reduce his basic human dignity.
life.author: Steven Biko

life.quote: I would like to remind the black ministry and indeed all black people that God is not in the habit of coming down from heaven to solve people's problems on earth.
life.author: Steven Biko

life.quote: What counts in life is not the mere fact that we have lived. It is what difference we have made to the lives of others that will determine the significance of the life we lead.
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: A good leader can engage in a debate frankly and thoroughly, knowing that at the end he and the other side must be closer, and thus emerge stronger. You don't have that idea when you are arrogant, superficial, and uninformed.
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: It is better to lead from behind and to put others in front, especially when you celebrate victory when nice things occur. You take the front line when there is danger. Then people will appreciate your leadership.
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: Be careful what you say. Words do not only describe reality. Words create reality.
life.author: Desmond Tutu

life.quote: The role of the teacher is to create the conditions for invention rather than provide ready-made knowledge.
life.author: Seymour Papert

life.quote: There comes a point where we need to stop just pulling people out of the river. We need to go upstream and find out why they're falling in.
life.author: Desmond Tutu

life.quote: You can't teach people everything they need to know. The best you can do is position them where they can find what they need to know when they need to know it.
life.author: Seymour Papert

life.quote: There is no passion to be found playing small - in settling for a life that is less than the one you are capable of living.
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: For to be free is not merely to cast off one's chains, but to live in a way that respects and enhances the freedom of others.
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: You are either alive and proud or you are dead, and when you are dead, you can't care anyway.
life.author: Steven Biko

life.quote: It only seems impossible until it's done.
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: What Black Consciousness seeks to do is to produce real black people who do not regard themselves as appendages to white society. We do not need to apologise for this because it is true that the white systems have produced through the world a number of people who are not aware that they too are people.
life.author: Steven Biko

life.quote: Our experience over the last 20 years has shown that indeed people must themselves become their own liberators. You cannot wait for somebody else to come and rescue you.
life.author: Thabo Mbeki

life.quote: It is in your hands to create a better world for all who live in it.
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: So as a prelude whites must be made to realise that they are only human, not superior. Same with Blacks. They must be made to realise that they are also human, not inferior.
life.author: Steven Biko

life.quote: If you are neutral in situations of injustice, you have chosen the side of the oppressor. If an elephant has its foot on the tail of a mouse, and you say that you are neutral, the mouse will not appreciate your neutrality.
life.author: Desmond Tutu

life.quote: Merely by describing yourself as black you have started on a road towards emancipation, you have committed yourself to fight against all forces that seek to use your blackness as a stamp that marks you out as a subservient being.
life.author: Steven Biko

life.quote: I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it.
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: When a man is denied to live the life he believes in, he has no choice but to become an outlaw.
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: It's always more important to be kind than to be right.
life.author: Rich Simmonds

life.quote: We should never become despondent because the weather is bad, nor should we turn triumphalist because the sun shines.
life.author: Thabo Mbeki

life.quote: When you say 'Black is beautiful' you are saying, 'Man you are okay as you are, begin to look upon yourself as a human being'.
life.author: Steven Biko

life.quote: A people without a positive history is like a vehicle without an engine.
life.author: Steven Biko

life.quote: If you want peace, you don't talk to your friends. You talk to your enemies.
life.author: Desmond Tutu

life.quote: If you want to make peace with your enemy, you have to work with your enemy. The he becomes your partner.
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: When will the day come that our dignity will be fully restored, when the purpose of our lives will no longer be merely to survive until the sun rises tomorrow!
life.author: Thabo Mbeki

life.quote: Hope is being able to see that there is light despite all of the darkness.
life.author: Desmond Tutu

life.quote: We have a vision of South Africa in which black and white shall live and work together as equals in conditions of peace and prosperity.
life.author: Oliver Tambo

life.quote: Every maker of video games knows something that the makers of curriculum don't seem to understand. You'll never see a video game being advertised as being easy. Kids who do not like school will tell you it's not because it's too hard. It's because it's--boring
life.author: Seymour Papert

life.quote: The scandal of education is that every time you teach something, you deprive a [student] of the pleasure and benefit of discovery.
life.author: Seymour Papert

life.quote: A real leader uses every issue, no matter how serious and sensitive, to ensure that at the end of the debate we should emerge stronger and more united than ever before.
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: May your choices reflect your hopes, not your fears.
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: Where globalization means, as it so often does, that the rich and powerful now have new means to further enrich and empower themselves at the cost of the poorer and weaker, we have a responsibility to protest in the name of universal freedom.
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: If you want to make peace with your enemy, you have to work with your enemy. Then he becomes your partner.
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: Don't judge me by my success, judge me by how many times I fell down and got up again
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: Like slavery and apartheid, poverty is not natural. It is man-made and it can be overcome and eradicated by the actions of human beings.
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: The great powers of the world may have done wonders in giving the world an industrial and military look but the great gift still has to come from Africa - giving the world a more human face.
life.author: Steven Biko

life.quote: My basic idea is that programming is the most powerful medium of developing the sophisticated and rigorous thinking needed for mathematics, for grammar, for physics, for statistics, for all the "hard" subjects.... In short, I believe more than ever that programming should be a key part of the intellectual development of people growing up.
life.author: Seymour Papert

life.quote: It is in your hands to create a better world for all who live in it.
life.author: Nelson Mandela

life.quote: We must realise that prophetic cry of black students: Black man you are on your own!
life.author: Steven Biko

life.quote: Many of our own people here in this country do not ask about computers, telephones and television sets. They ask - when will we get a road to our village.
life.author: Thabo Mbeki

life.quote: Making mistakes is the privilege of the active. It is always the mediocre people who are negative, who spend their time proving that they were not wrong.
life.author: Ingvar Kamprad

life.quote: The key to happiness is good health and a bad memory
life.author: Ingrid Bergman

life.quote: Friendship needs no words...
life.author: Dag Hammarskjold

life.quote: The most dangerous poison is the feeling of achievement. The antidote is to every evening think what can be done better tomorrow.
life.author: Ingvar Kamprad

life.quote: Time is your most important resource. You can do so much in ten minutes. Ten minutes; once gone is gone for good.
life.author: Ingvar Kamprad

life.quote: Only those who are asleep make no mistakes.
life.author: Ingvar Kamprad

life.quote: The IKEA spirit is strong and living reality. Simplicity in our behavior gives us strength. Simplicity and humbleness characterize us in our relations with each others, our suppliers and our customers.
life.author: Ingvar Kamprad

life.quote: Happiness is not reaching your goal. Happiness is being on the way.
life.author: Ingvar Kamprad

life.quote: Simplicity and common sense should characterize planning and strategic direction.
life.author: Ingvar Kamprad

life.quote: Happiness is good health and a bad memory.
life.author: Ingrid Bergman

life.quote: Waste of resources is a mortal sin at IKEA.
life.author: Ingvar Kamprad

life.quote: Ikea people do not drive flashy cars or stay at luxury hotels.
life.author: Ingvar Kamprad

life.quote: If there is such a thing as good leadership, it is to give a good example. I have to do so for all the Ikea employees.
life.author: Ingvar Kamprad

life.quote: Corporal punishment is as humiliating for him who gives it as for him who receives it; it is ineffective besides. Neither shame nor physical pain have any other effect than a hardening one.
life.author: Ellen Key

life.quote: I like the sea: we understand one another. It is always yearning, sighing for something it cannot have; and so am I.
life.author: Greta Garbo

life.quote: Contentment is the only real wealth.
life.author: Alfred Nobel

life.quote: The rights of democracy are not reserved for a select group within society, they are the rights of all the people.
life.author: Olof Palme

life.quote: Happiness lies in good health and a bad memory.
life.author: Ingrid Bergman

life.quote: If a tree dies, plant another in its place.
life.author: Carolus Linnaeus

life.quote: Constant attention by a good nurse may be just as important as a major operation by a surgeon.
life.author: Dag Hammarskjold

life.quote: If I have a thousand ideas and only one turns out to be good, I am satisfied.
life.author: Alfred Nobel

life.quote: No form of art goes beyond ordinary consciousness as film does, straight to our emotions, deep into the twilight room of the soul.
life.author: Ingmar Bergman
