life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: A thing is neither better nor worse for having been praised
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Take care that you don’t treat inhumanity as it treats human beings
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: A person’s worth is measured by the worth of what he values
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: An ignorant person is inclined to blame others for his own misfortune. To blame oneself is proof of progress. But the wise man never has to blame another or himself
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: The mind in itself has no needs, except for those it creates itself. Is undisturbed, except for its own disturbances. Knows no obstructions, except those from within
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Whatever anyone does or says, I must be good, just as if the gold, or the emerald, or the purple were always saying this, whatever anyone does or says, I must be emerald and keep my color
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Your three components: body, breath, mind. Two are yours in trust; to the third alone you have clear title
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: No one objects to what is useful to him. To be of use to others is natural. Then don’t object to what is useful to you – being of use
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: When I see that one thing [virtue] is supreme and most important, I cannot say that something else is, just to make you happy
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: A boxer derives the greatest advantage from his sparring partner – and my accuser is my sparring partner. He trains me in patience, civility and even temper
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Either you’re going to be depressed when your wish is not realized or foolishly pleased with yourself if it is, overjoyed for the wrong reasons
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: I say that virtue is more valuable than wealth to the same degree that eyes are more valuable than fingernails
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: How much more grievous are the consequences of anger than the causes of it
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Most of us dread the deadening of the body and will do anything to avoid it. About the deadening of the soul, however, we don’t care one iota
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Don’t let outward appearances mislead you into thinking that someone with more prestige, power or some other distinction must on that account be happy
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: As you are careful when you walk not to step on a nail or turn your ankle, so you should take care not to do any injury to your character at the same time
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: If you lost the capacity to read, or play music, you would think it was a disaster, but you think nothing of losing the capacity to be honest, decent and civilized
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Things do not touch the soul, for they are external and remain immovable; so our perturbations come only from our inner opinions
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: We are too much accustomed to attribute to a single cause that which is the product of several, and the majority of our controversies come from that
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Pleasures, when they go beyond a certain limit, are but punishments
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: As it is with a play, so it is with life – what matters is not how long the acting lasts, but how good it is. It is not important at what point you stop. Stop wherever you will – only make sure that you round it off with a good ending
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: He often acts unjustly who does not do a certain thing; not only he who does a certain thing
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: If someone is incapable of distinguishing good things from bad and neutral things from either – well, how could such a person be capable of love? The power to love, then, belongs only to the wise man
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Often injustice lies in what you aren’t doing, not only in what you are doing
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Stop wishing for something else to happen, for a different fate. That is to live a false life
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Enough of this miserable, whining life. Stop monkeying around! Why are you troubled? What’s new here? What’s so confounding? The one responsible? Take a good look. Or just the matter itself? Then look at that. There’s nothing else to look at. And as far as the gods go, by now you could try being more straightforward and kind. It’s the same, whether you’ve examined these things for a hundred years, or only three
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Mastery of reading and writing requires a master. Still, more so life
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Consider that as the heaps of sand piled on one another hide the former sands, so in life the events that go before are soon covered by those that come after
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: If, at some point in your life, you should come across anything better than justice, honesty, self-control, courage – than a mind satisfied that is has succeeded in enabling you to act rationally, and satisfied to accept what’s beyond its control – if you find anything better than that, embrace it without reservations – it must be an extraordinary thing indeed – and enjoy it to the full
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Where a man can live, he can also live well
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Treat what you don’t have as nonexistent. Look at what you have, the things you value most, and think of how much you’d crave them if you didn’t have them. But be careful. Don’t feel such satisfaction that you start to overvalue them – that it would upset you to lose them
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Just ask whether they put their self-interest in externals or in moral choice. If it’s in externals, you cannot call them friends, any more than you can call them trustworthy, consistent, courageous or free
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: While you live, while it is in your power, be good
life.author: Marcus Aurelius
Marcus Aurelius
life.quote: What is the goal of virtue, after all, except a life that flows smoothly?

life.author: Marcus Aurelius
life.quote: For where else is friendship found if not with fairness, reliability and respect for virtue only?
You will give yourself relief, if you do every act of your life as if it were the last
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Do not act as if you were going to live ten thousand years. Death hangs over you. While you live, while it is in your power, be good
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Be cheerful also, and do not seek external help or the tranquillity that others give. A man then must stand erect, not be kept erect by others
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: The art of life is more like the wrestler’s art than the dancer’s, in respect of this, that it should stand ready and firm to meet onsets that are sudden and unexpected
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: The object in life is not to be on the side of the majority, but to escape finding oneself in the ranks of the insane
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: The history of your life is now complete and your service is ended: and how many beautiful things you have seen; and how many pleasures and pains you have despised; and how many things called honorable you have spurned; and to how many ill-minded folks you have shown a kind disposition
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Life is neither good or evil, but only a place for good and evil
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Anything in any way beautiful derives its beauty from itself and asks nothing beyond itself. Praise is no part of it, for nothing is made worse or better by praise
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Every day as it comes should be welcomed and reduced forthwith into our own possession as if it were the finest day imaginable. What flies past has to be seized at
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: The art of living is more like wrestling than dancing
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Don’t hope that events will turn out the way you want, welcome events in whichever way they happen: this is the path to peace.
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Nothing is as encouraging as when virtues are visibly embodied in the people around us, when we’re practically showered with them
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: The tranquillity that comes when you stop caring what they say. Or think, or do. Only what you do
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Do not indulge in dreams of having what you have not, but reckon up the chief of the blessings you do possess, and then thankfully remember how you would crave for them if they were not yours
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: When they’re really possessed by what they do, they’d rather stop eating and sleeping than give up practicing their arts
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: People look for retreats for themselves, in the country, by the coast, or in the hills… There is nowhere that a person can find a more peaceful and trouble-free retreat than in his own mind… So constantly give yourself this retreat, and renew yourself
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: The things that are essential are acquired with little bother; it is the luxuries that call for toil and effort
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: When you wish to delight yourself, think of the virtues of those who live with you; for instance, the activity of one, the modesty of another, the liberality of a third, and some other good quality of a fourth
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: To the gods I am indebted for having good grandfathers, good parents, a good sister, good teachers, good associates, good kinsmen and friends, nearly everything good. For all these [blessings in my life] require the help of the gods and fortune
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: All you need are these: certainty of judgment in the present moment; action for the common good in the present moment; and an attitude of gratitude in the present moment for anything that comes your way
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Nothing is burdensome if taken lightly, and how nothing need arouse one’s irritation so long as one doesn’t make it bigger than it is by getting irritated
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: You can discard most of the junk that clutters your mind – things that exist only there – and clear out space for yourself: by comprehending the scale of the world, by contemplating infinite time, by thinking of the speed with which things change – each part of every thing; the narrow space between our birth and death; the infinite time before; the equality unbounded time that follows
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Her reverence for the divine, her generosity, her inability not only to do wrong but even to conceive of doing it. And the simple way she lived – not in the least like the rich
life.author: Marcus Aurelius (What Marcus learned from his mother)

life.quote: If you seek tranquility, do less. Or do what’s essential – what the logos of a social being requires, and in the requisite way. Which brings a double satisfaction: to do less, better. Because most of what we say and do is not essential. If you can eliminate it, you’ll have more time, and more tranquility. Ask yourself at every moment, ‘Is this necessary?’
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Think not so much of what you lack as of what you have: but of the things that you have, select the best, and then reflect how eagerly you would have sought them if you did not have them
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Remind yourself that it is not the future or what has passed that afflicts you, but always the present
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Today I have got out of all trouble, or rather I have cast out all trouble, for it was not outside, but within and in my opinions
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Don’t waste the rest of your time here worrying about other people – unless it affects the common good. It will keep you from doing anything useful. You’ll be too preoccupied with what so-and-so is doing, and why, and what the’re saying, and what they’re thinking, and what they’re up to, and all the other things that throw you off and keep you from focusing on your own mind
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: You can pass your life in an equable flow of happiness if you can follow the right way and think and act in the right way
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Failure to observe what is in the mind of another has seldom made a man unhappy; but those who do not observe the movements of their own minds must of necessity be unhappy
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Set yourself in motion, if it is in your power, and do not look about you to see if anyone will observe it; nor yet expect Plato’s Republic: but be content if the smallest thing goes on well, and consider such an event to be no small matter
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts: therefore, guard accordingly, and take care that you entertain no notions unsuitable to virtue and reasonable nature
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Here is a rule to remember in future, when anything tempts you to feel bitter: not "This is misfortune," but "To bear this worthily is good fortune"
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: He who lives in harmony with himself lives in harmony with the universe
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: You must turn to profit the present by the aid of reason and justice
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: A key point to bear in mind: The value of attentiveness varies in proportion to its object. You’re better off not giving the small things more time than they deserve
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Forget everything else. Keep hold of this alone and remember it: Each of us lives only now, this brief instant. The rest has been lived already, or is impossible to see
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Brief is man’s life and small the nook of the earth where he lives; brief, too, is the longest posthumous fame, buoyed only by a succession of poor human beings who will very soon die and who know little of themselves, much less of someone who died long ago
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: How much time he saves who does not look to see what his neighbor says or does or thinks
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Altogether the interval is small between birth and death; and consider with how much trouble, and in company with what sort of people and in what a feeble body, this interval is laboriously passed
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Keep in mind how fast things pass by and are gone – those that are now and those to come. Existence flows past us like a river: the ‘what’ is in constant flux, the ‘why’ has a thousand variations. Nothing is stable, not even what’s right here. The infinity of past and future gapes before us – a chasm whose depths we cannot see
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: How short is the time from birth to dissolution, and the illimitable time before birth as well as the equally boundless time after dissolution
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: The perfection of moral character consists in this, in passing every day as if it were the last, and in being neither violently excited nor torpid nor playing the hypocrite
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Think of all the years passed by in which you said to yourself "I’ll do it tomorrow," and how the gods have again and again granted you periods of grace of which you have not availed yourself. It is time to realize that you are a member of the Universe, that you are born of Nature itself, and to know that a limit has been set to your time. Use every moment wisely, to perceive your inner refulgence, or ’twill be gone and nevermore within your reach
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Not to waste time on nonsense
life.author: Marcus Aurelius (What Marcus learned from Diognetus)

life.quote: Life is warfare… Then what can guide us? Only philosophy
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: No role is so well suited to philosophy as the one you happen to be in right now
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: The first thing a pretender to philosophy must do is get rid of their presuppositions; a person is not going to undertake to learn anything that they think they already know
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: "It’s unfortunate that this has happened". No. It’s fortunate that this has happened and I’ve remained unharmed by it — not shattered by the present or frightened of the future. It could have happened to anyone. But not everyone could have remained unharmed by it
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Take a good hard look at people’s ruling principle, especially of the wise, what they run away from and what they seek out
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: People who are physically ill are unhappy with a doctor who doesn’t give them advice, because they think he has given up on them. Shouldn’t we feel the same towards a philosopher – and assume that he has given up hope of our ever becoming rational – if he will no longer tell us what we need (but may not like) to hear?
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Your mind will take the shape of what you frequently hold in thought, for the human spirit is colored by such impressions
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: My advice is really this: what we hear the philosophers saying and what we find in their writings should be applied in our pursuit of the happy life. We should hunt out the helpful pieces of teaching, and the spirited and noble-minded sayings which are capable of immediate practical application – not far-fetched or archaic expressions or extravagant metaphors and figures of speech – and learn them so well that words become works
life.author: Unknown

life.quote: The work of philosophy is simple and modest. Do not draw me aside into pomposity
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: It stares you in the face. No role is so well suited to philosophy as the one you happen to be in right now
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: This, then, is the beginning of philosophy – an awareness of one’s own mental fitness
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: This presumption that you possess knowledge of any use has to be dropped before you approach philosophy – just as if we were enrolling in a school of music or mathematics
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Reflect on the other social roles you play. If you are a council member, consider what a council member should do. If you are young, what does being young mean, if you are old, what does age imply, if you are a father, what does fatherhood entail? Each of our titles, when reflected upon, suggests the acts appropriate to it
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: What then can guide a man? One thing and only one, philosophy. But this consists in keeping the daimon within a man free from violence and unharmed, superior to pains and pleasures, doing nothing without a purpose, nor yet falsely and with hypocrisy
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: If you commit to philosophy, be prepared at once to be laughed at and made the butt of many snide remarks
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: My city and country, so far as I am Antoninus, is Rome; but so far as I am a man, it is the world
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Do you want to know if you are educated? Show us your values, philosopher
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: You don’t love yourself enough. Or you’d love your nature too, and what it demands of you
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Consider if you have behaved to all in such a way that this way be said of you: Never has he wronged a man in deed or word
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: What is divine deserves our affection because it is good; what is human deserves our affection because it is like us
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: People who love what they do wear themselves down doing it, they even forget to wash or eat
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: The spiritual meaning of love is measured by what it can do. Love is meant to heal. Love is meant to renew. Love is meant to bring us closer to God
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: [Treat] unenlightened souls with sympathy and indulgence, remembering that they are ignorant or mistaken about what’s most important. Never be harsh, remember Plato’s dictum: ‘Every soul is deprived of the truth against its will’
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Shall any man hate me? That will be his affair. But I will be mild and benevolent toward every man, and ready to show even him his mistake, not reproachfully, nor yet as making a display of my endurance, but nobly and honestly
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Accustom yourself to attend carefully to what is said by another, and as much as it is possible, try to inhabit the speaker’s mind
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: In your conversation, don’t dwell at excessive length on your own deeds or adventures. Just because you enjoy recounting your exploits doesn’t mean that others derive the same pleasure from hearing about them
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: One thing here is worth a great deal: to pass your life in truth and justice, with a benevolent disposition even to liars and unjust men
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Refer your action to no other end than the common good
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Do not be whirled about, but in every movement have respect to justice, and on the occasion of every impression maintain the faculty of comprehension or understanding
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: If a man is mistaken, instruct him kindly and show him his error. But if you are not able, blame yourself, or not even yourself
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: When you have trouble getting out of bed in the morning, remember that your defining characteristic – what defines a human being — is to work with others. Even animals know how to sleep. And it’s the characteristic activity that’s the more natural one – more innate and more satisfying
life.author: Marcus Aurelius
Marcus Aurelius
life.quote: Is helping others less valuable to you? Not worth your effort?
From my brother Severus to love my kin, and to love truth, and to love justice
life.author: Marcus Aurelius (What Marcus learned from Severus)

life.quote: To show intuitive sympathy for friends, tolerance to amateurs and sloppy thinkers
life.author: Marcus Aurelius (What Marcus learned from Sextus)

life.quote: From Sextus to tolerate ignorant persons, and those who form opinions without consideration
life.author: Marcus Aurelius (What Marcus learned from Sextus)

life.quote: To have learned how to accept favors from friends without losing your self-respect or appearing ungrateful
life.author: Marcus Aurelius (What Marcus learned from Apollonius)

life.quote: His respect for people who practiced philosophy – at least, those who were sincere about it. But without denigrating the others – or listening to them
life.author: Marcus Aurelius (What Marcus learned from his adopted father)

life.quote: Never value anything as profitable that compels you to break your promise, to lose your self-respect, to hate any man, to suspect, to curse, to act the hypocrite, to desire anything that needs walls and curtains
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Only attend to yourself, and resolve to be a good man in every act that you do
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: We ought to do good to others as simply as a horse runs, or a bee makes honey, or a vine bears grapes season after season without thinking of the grapes it has borne
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Adapt yourself to the things among which your lot has been cast and love sincerely the fellow creatures with whom destiny has ordained that you shall live
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: What is your art? To be good. And how is this accomplished well except by general principles, some about the nature of the universe, and others about the proper constitution of man?
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: People exist for one another. You can instruct or endure them
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: As an antidote to battle unkindness we were given kindness
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: What is your vocation? To be a good person.
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Whatever any one does or says, I must be good, just as if the emerald (or the gold or the purple) were always saying "Whatever any one does or says, I must be emerald and keep my color"
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: First, do nothing inconsiderately or without a purpose. Second, make your acts refer to nothing else but a social end
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: When a guide meets up with someone who is lost, ordinarily his reaction is to direct him on the right path, not mock or malign him, then turn on his heel and walk away. As for you, lead someone to the truth and you will find that he can follow. But as long as you don’t point it out to him, don’t make fun of him; be aware of what you need to work on instead
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: That no one could ever have felt patronized by him – or in a position to patronize him. A sense of humour
life.author: Marcus Aurelius (What Marcus learned from Maximus)

life.quote: No matter what anyone says or does, my task is to be good
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: If you have been placed in a position above others, are you automatically going to behave like a despot? Remember who you are and whom you govern – that they are kinsmen, brothers by nature, fellow descendants of Zeus
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: ‘Well, what will my profession in the community be?’ Whatever position you are equipped to fill, so long as you preserve the man of trust and integrity
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Perhaps there are none more lazy, or more truly ignorant, than your everlasting readers
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Let men see, let them know, a real man, who lives as he was meant to live
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: To be feared is to fear: no one has been able to strike terror into others and at the same time enjoy peace of mind himself
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Have I done something for the common good? Then I share in the benefits. To stay centered on that. Not to give up
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: The secret of all victory lies in the organization of the non-obvious
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: A man’s worth is no greater than his ambitions
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Another person will not hurt you without your cooperation; you are hurt the moment you believe yourself to be
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Ambition means tying your well-being to what other people say or do. Self-indulgence means tying it to the things that happen to you. Sanity means tying it to your own actions
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: To understand the true quality of people, you must look into their minds, and examine their pursuits and aversions
life.author: Marcus Aurelius
Marcus Aurelius
life.quote: When you’ve done well and another has benefited by it, why like a fool do you look for a third thing on top— credit for the good deed or a favor in return?

A noble man compares and estimates himself by an idea which is higher than himself; and a mean man, by one lower than himself. The one produces aspiration; the other ambition, which is the way in which a vulgar man aspires
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: The following are non-sequiturs: ‘I am richer, therefore superior to you’; or ‘I am a better speaker, therefore a better person, than you’
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Something good should be a source of pride, correct? ‘Yes.’ And can one really take pride in a momentary pleasure? Please don’t say yes
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: All our efforts must be directed towards an end, or we will act in vain. If it is not the right end, we will fail utterly
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: So when you hear that even life and the like are indifferent, don’t become apathetic; and by the same token, when you’re advised to care about them, don’t become superficial and conceive a passion for externals
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Whenever externals are more important to you than your own integrity, then be prepared to serve them the remainder of your life
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Being attached to many things, we are weighed down and dragged along with them
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Nothing important comes into being overnight; even grapes or figs need time to ripen. If you say that you want a fig now, I will tell you to be patient. First, you must allow the tree to flower, then put forth fruit; then you have to wait until the fruit is ripe. So if the fruit of a fig tree is not brought to maturity instantly or in an hour, how do you expect the human mind to come to fruition, so quickly and easily?
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Never get into family fights over material things; give them up willingly, and your moral standing will increase in proportion
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: If you are pained by external things, it is not they that disturb you, but your own judgement of them. And it is in your power to wipe out that judgement now
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: To be sure, external things of whatever kind require skill in their use, but we must not grow attached to them; whatever they are, they should only serve for us to show how skilled we are in our handling of them
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Do as Socrates did, never replying to the question of where he was from with, ‘I am Athenian,’ or ‘I am from Corinth,’ but always, ‘I am a citizen of the world’
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Just prove to me that you are trustworthy, high-minded and reliable, and that your intentions are benign – prove to me that your jar doesn’t have a hole in it – and you’ll find that I won’t even wait for you to open your heart to me, I’ll be the first to implore you to lend an ear to my own affairs
life.author: Marcus Aurelius
Marcus Aurelius
life.quote: When you have done a good act and another has received it, why do you look for a third thing besides these, as fools do, either to have the reputation of having done a good act or to obtain a return?
If money is your only standard, then consider that, by your lights, someone who loses their nose does not suffer any harm
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: It is not right that anything of any other kind, such as praise from the many, or power, or enjoyment of pleasure, should come into competition with that which is rationally and politically and practically good
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Perhaps the desire of the thing called fame torments you. See how soon everything is forgotten, and look at the chaos of infinite time on each side of the present, and the emptiness of applause, and the fickleness and lack of judgment in those who pretend to give praise, and the narrowness of its domain, and be quiet at last
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Or is it your reputation that’s bothering you? But look at how soon we’re all forgotten. The abyss of endless time that swallows it all. The emptiness of those applauding hands. The people who praise us; how capricious they are, how arbitrary. And the tiny region it takes place. The whole earth a point in space – and most of it uninhabited
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Give thyself time to learn something new and good, and cease to be whirled around
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Despise not death, but welcome it, for nature wills it like all else
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Think of yourself as dead. You have lived your life. Now take what’s left and live it properly.
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: A brief existence is common to all things, and yet you avoid and pursue all things as if they would be eternal
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Death. The end of sense-perception, of being controlled by our emotions, of mental activity, of enslavement to our bodies
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: You could leave life right now. Let that determine what you do and say and think
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Death and pain are not frightening, it’s the fear of pain and death we need to fear. Which is why we praise the poet who wrote, ‘Death is not fearful, but dying like a coward is’
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: On the occasion of every act ask yourself, "How is this with respect to me? Will I regret it? A little time and I am dead, and all is gone"
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Speaking for myself, I hope death overtakes me when I’m occupied solely with the care of my character, in an effort to make it passionless, free, unrestricted and unrestrained
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Not to live as if you had endless years ahead of you. Death overshadows you. While you’re alive and able – be good
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Death, like birth, is a secret of Nature
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: When somebody’s wife or child dies, to a man we all routinely say, ‘Well, that’s part of life.’ But if one of our own family is involved, then right away it’s ‘Poor, poor me!’ We would do better to remember how we react when a similar loss afflicts others
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Every part of me then will be reduced by change into some part of the universe, and that again will change into another part of the universe, and so on forever
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Since it is possible that you might depart from life this very moment, regulate every act and thought accordingly
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Think continually that all kinds of men, pursuits, and nations are dead
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: How quickly things disappear: in the universe the bodies themselves, but in time the memory of them
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Whether it is a dispersion, or a resolution into atoms, or annihilation, it is either extinction or change
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Finally, waiting for death with a cheerful mind, as being nothing else than a dissolution of the elements of which every living being is compounded
life.author: But if there is no harm to the elements themselves in each continually changing into another, why should a man have any apprehension about the change and dissolution of all the elements?

life.quote: Death is necessary and cannot be avoided. I mean, where am I going to go to get away from it?
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Think not disdainfully of death, but look on it with favor; for even death is one of the things that Nature wills
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: One thing I know: all the works of mortal man lie under sentence of mortality; we live among things that are destined to perish
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Death is a release from the impressions of the senses, and from desires that make us their puppets, and from the vagaries of the mind, and from the hard service of the flesh
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Because we’re the only animals who not only die but are conscious of it even while it happens, we are beset by anxiety
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: This, then, is consistent with the character of a reflecting man, to be neither careless nor impatient nor contemptuous with respect to death, but to wait for it as one of the operations of nature
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: The act of dying is one of the acts of life
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Death is not an evil. What is it then? The one law mankind has that is free of all discrimination
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: (A tough one) There is no man so fortunate that there shall not be by him when he is dying some who are pleased with what is going to happen
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: I cannot escape death, but at least I can escape the fear of it
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: When thou art above measure angry, bethink thee how momentary is man’s life
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: To expect punishment is to suffer it; and to earn it is to expect it
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Who wants to live with delusion and prejudice, being unjust, undisciplined, mean and ungrateful? ‘No one.’ No bad person, then, lives the way he wants, and no bad man is free
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: He who does wrong does wrong against himself. He who acts unjustly acts unjustly to himself, because he makes himself bad
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Show me someone untroubled with disturbing thoughts about illness, danger, death, exile or loss of reputation. By all the gods, I want to see a Stoic!
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Not to display anger or other emotions. To be free of passion and yet full of love
life.author: Marcus Aurelius (What Marcus learned from Sextus)

life.quote: When another blames you or hates you, or when men say anything injurious about you, approach their poor souls, penetrate within, and see what kind of men they are. You will discover that there is no reason to be concerned that these men have this or that opinion about you
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Consider how much more you often suffer from your anger and grief, than from those very things for which you are angry and grieved
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Pain is neither intolerable nor everlasting if you bear in mind that it has its limits, and if you add nothing to it in imagination
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Now think of the things which goad man into destroying man: they are hope, envy, hatred, fear and contempt
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Our anger and annoyance are more detrimental to us than the things themselves which anger or annoy us
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: If you like doing something, do it regularly; if you don’t like doing something, make a habit of doing something different. The same goes for moral inclinations. When you get angry, you should know that you aren’t guilty of an isolated lapse, you’ve encouraged a trend and thrown fuel on the fire
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: If you shall be afraid not because you must some time cease to live, but if you shall fear never to have begun to live according to nature – then you will be a man worthy of the universe that has produced you, and you will cease to be a stranger in your native land
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: The love of power or money or luxurious living are not the only things which are guided by popular thinking. We take our cue from people’s thinking even in the way we feel pain
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: ‘My brother is unfair to me.’ Well then, keep up your side of the relationship; don’t concern yourself with his behaviour, only with what you must do to keep your will in tune with nature
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: If you don’t want to be cantankerous, don’t feed your temper, or multiply incidents of anger. Suppress the first impulse to be angry, then begin to count the days on which you don’t get mad
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Provoked by the sight of a handsome man or a beautiful woman, you will discover within you the contrary power of self-restraint. Faced with pain, you will discover the power of endurance. If you are insulted, you will discover patience. In time, you will grow to be confident that there is not a single impression that you will not have the moral means to tolerate
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Pain too is just a scary mask: look under it and you will see. The body sometimes suffers, but relief is never far behind. And if that isn’t good enough for you, the door stands open; otherwise put up with it. The door needs to stay open whatever the circumstances, with the result that our problems disappear
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: The mind maintains its own tranquillity by retiring into itself, and the ruling faculty is not made worse. But the parts that are harmed by pain, let them, if they can, give their opinion about it
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: So there is the comforting thing about extremities of pain: if you feel it too much you are bound to stop feeling it
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: It is our own opinions that disturb us. Take away these opinions then, and resolve to dismiss your judgment about an act as if it were something grievous, and your anger is gone
life.author: Marcus Aurelius
Marcus Aurelius
life.quote: Why should we feel anger at the world? As if the world would notice?
A man must learn a great deal to enable him to pass a correct judgment on another man’s acts
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: It’s silly to try to escape other people’s faults. They are inescapable. Just try to escape your own
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: When another blames you or hates you, or people voice similar criticisms, go to their souls, penetrate inside and see what sort of people they are. You will realize that there is no need to be racked with anxiety that they should hold any particular opinion about you
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: With what are you discontented? With the badness of men? Recall to your mind this conclusion, that rational animals exist for one another, and that to endure is a part of justice, and that men do wrong involuntarily
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: When you are offended at any man’s fault, immediately turn to yourself and reflect in what manner you yourself have erred: for example, in thinking that money is a good thing or pleasure, or a bit of reputation, and the like
life.author: Marcus Aurelius
Marcus Aurelius
life.quote: Whenever you are about to find fault with someone, ask yourself the following question: What fault of mine most nearly resembles the one I am about to criticize?
You don’t have to turn this into something. It doesn’t have to upset you. Things can’t shape our decisions by themselves
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: If they’ve injured you, then they’re the ones who suffer for it. But have they?
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: I do what is mine to do; the rest doesn’t disturb me. The rest is inanimate, or has no logos, or it wanders at random and has lost the road
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Let it happen, if it wants, to whatever it can happen to. And what’s affected can complain about it if it wants. It doesn’t hurt me unless I interpret its happening as harmful to me. I can choose not to
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: To live in peace, immune to all compulsion. Let them scream whatever they want
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Consider that you also do many things wrong, and that you are a man like others; and even if you do abstain from certain faults, still you have the disposition to commit them, though either through cowardice, or concern about reputation, or some such mean motive, you abstain from such faults
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: No time for reading. For controlling your arrogance, yes. For overcoming pain and pleasure, yes. For outgrowing ambition, yes. For not feeling anger at stupid and unpleasant people – even for caring about them – for that, yes
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: To be angry at something means you’ve forgotten: That everything that happens is natural. That the responsibility is theirs, not yours
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Practice really hearing what people say. Do your best to get inside their minds
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: How trivial the things we want so passionately are
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Discard your misperceptions. Stop being jerked like a puppet. Limit yourself to the present.
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Just that you do the right thing. The rest doesn’t matter
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Live out your life in truth and justice, tolerant of those who are neither true nor just
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: If someone is able to show me that what I think or do is not right, I will happily change, for I seek the truth, by which no one was ever truly harmed. It is the person who continues in his self-deception and ignorance who is harmed
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: In a little while you will have forgotten everything; in a little while everything will have forgotten you
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Now it is in my power to let no badness be in this soul, nor desire nor any perturbation at all; but looking at all things, I see their true nature, and I use each according to its value
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Take me and cast me where you will; for there I shall keep my divine part tranquil, that is, content, if it can feel and act conformably to its proper constitution
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: How small a part of the boundless and unfathomable time is assigned to every man! For it is very soon swallowed up in the eternal. And how small a part of the whole substance! And how small a part of the universal soul! And on what a small clod of the whole earth you creep!
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Say to yourself each time, ‘He did what he believed was right’ (When someone does something you don’t like)
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Whenever anyone criticizes or wrongs you, remember that they are only doing or saying what they think is right. They cannot be guided by your views, only their own; so if their views are wrong, they are the ones who suffer insofar as they are misguided
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Constantly and, if it be possible, on the occasion of every impression on the soul, apply to it the principles of physics, ethics, and dialectics (logic)
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: When you wake up in the morning, tell yourself: The people I deal with today will be meddling, ungrateful, arrogant, dishonest, jealous and surely… None of them can hurt me. Don’t waste the rest of your time here worrying about other people… It will keep you from doing anything useful. Why do you not rather act than complain?
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Perfect tranquility within consists in the good ordering of the mind, the realm of your own
life.author: Marcus Aurelius
Marcus Aurelius
life.quote: Why are we still lazy, indifferent and dull? Why do we look for excuses to avoid training and exercising our powers of reason?
Because what is a human being? Part of a community – the community of gods and men, primarily, and secondarily that of the city we happen to inhabit, which is only a microcosm of the universe in toto
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Resolve to accept whatever happens as necessary and familiar, flowing like water from that same source and spring
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: For what does reason purport to do? "Establish what is true, eliminate what is false and suspend judgement in doubtful cases"
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Either all things proceed from one intelligent source and come together as in one body, and the part ought not to find fault with what is done for the benefit of the whole; or there are only atoms, and nothing else than mixture and dispersion. Why, then, are you disturbed?
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Whether the universe is a concourse of atoms, or nature is a system, let this first be established: that I am a part of the whole that is governed by nature; next, that I stand in some intimate connection with other kindred parts
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Whatever the nature of the whole does, and whatever serves to maintain it, is good for every part of nature
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: The man who spends his time choosing one resort after another in a hunt for peace and quiet, will in every place he visits find something to prevent him from relaxing
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: To investigate and analyze, with understanding and logic, the principles we ought to live by
life.author: Marcus Aurelius (What Marcus learned from Sextus)

life.quote: The way he handled the material comforts that fortune had supplied him in such abundance – without arrogance and without apology. If they were there, he took advantage of them. If not, he didn’t miss them
life.author: Marcus Aurelius (What Marcus learned from his adopted father)

life.quote: To rest in these principles only: the one, that nothing will happen to me which is not conformable to the nature of the universe; and the other, that it is in my power never to act contrary to my god and daimon: for there is no man who will compel me to this
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: It is a proper work of a man to be benevolent to his own kind, to despise the movements of the senses, to form a just judgment of plausible appearances, and to take a survey of the nature of the universe and of the things that happen in it
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Constantly recall those who have complained greatly about anything, those who have been most conspicuous by the greatest fame or misfortunes or enmities or fortunes of any kind: then think, where are they all now? Smoke and ash and a tale, or not even a tale
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Whatever the universal nature assigns to any man at any time is for the good of that man at that time
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Observe constantly that all things take place by change, and accustom thyself to consider that the nature of the Universe loves nothing so much as to change the things which are, and to make new things like them
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Nowhere can man find a quieter or more untroubled retreat than in his own soul.
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Others have been plundered, indiscriminately, set upon, betrayed, beaten up, attacked with poison or with calumny – mention anything you like, it has happened to plenty of people
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: With respect to what may happen to you from without, consider that it happens either by chance or according to Providence, and you must neither blame chance nor accuse Providence
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: All disturbances arise solely from the opinions within us
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: To move from one unselfish action to another with God in mind. Only there, delight and stillness
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: He who is afraid of pain will sometimes also be afraid of some of the things that will happen in the world, and even this is impiety. And he who pursues pleasure will not abstain from injustice, and this is plainly impiety
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: ‘A fool cannot be convinced or even compelled to renounce his folly.’ God save me from fools with a little philosophy – no one is more difficult to reach
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: You ought to realize, you take up very little space in the world as a whole – your body, that is; in reason, however, you yield to no one, not even to the gods, because reason is not measured in size but sense. So why not care for that side of you, where you and the gods are equals?
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: You might as well get on your knees and pray that your nose won’t run. A better idea would be to wipe your nose and forgo the prayer. The point is, isn’t there anything God gave you for your present problem?
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Live a good life. If there are gods and they are just, then they will not care how devout you have been, but will welcome you based on the virtues you have lived by. If there are gods, but unjust, then you should not want to worship them. If there are no gods, then you will be gone, but will have lived a noble life that will live on in the memories of your loved ones.
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Injustice is impiety. For since the universal nature has made rational animals for the sake of one another to help one another according to their deserts, but in no way to injure one another, he who transgresses her will is clearly guilty of impiety toward the highest divinity
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: The gods are not to blame. They do nothing wrong, on purpose or by accident. Nor men either; they don’t do it on purpose. No one is to blame
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Loss is nothing else but change, and change is Nature’s delight
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: How easy it is to repel and to wipe away every impression which is troublesome or unsuitable, and immediately to be in all tranquility
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Never let the future disturb you. You will meet it, if you have to, with the same weapons of reason which today arm you against the present
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Does what’s happened keep you from acting with justice, generosity, self-control, sanity, prudence, honesty, humility, straightforwardness, and all other qualities that allow a person’s nature to fulfill itself? So remember this principle when something threatens to cause you pain: the thing itself was no misfortune at all; to endure it and prevail is great good fortune
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Stop allowing your mind to be a slave, to be jerked about by selfish impulses, to kick against fate and the present, and to mistrust the future
life.author: Marcus Aurelius
Marcus Aurelius
life.quote: Accept whatever comes to you woven in the pattern of your destiny, for what could more aptly fit your needs?
The world is maintained by change – in the elements and in the things they compose. That should be enough for you; treat it as an axiom
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: But if you accept the obstacle and work with what you’re given, an alternative will present itself – another piece of what you’re trying to assemble. Action by action
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Bear in mind that everything that exists is already fraying at the edges, and in transition, subject to fragmentation and to rot. Or that everything was born to die
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Before long, nature, which controls it all, will alter everything you see and use it as material for something else – over and over again. So that the world is continually renewed
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Don’t be disappointed if you return home with the very same set of ideas you arrived with. Because you had no intention of changing, correcting or adopting others in their place
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: If we try to adapt our mind to the regular sequence of changes and accept the inevitable with good grace, our life will proceed quite smoothly and harmoniously
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: In like manner view also the other epochs of time and of whole nations, and see how many after great efforts soon fell and were resolved into the elements
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: All things are changing: and you yourself are in continuous mutation and in a manner in continuous destruction, and the whole universe, too
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: It is in no man’s power to have whatever he wants; but he has it in his power not to wish for what he hasn’t got, and cheerfully make the most of the things that do come his way
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Everything that exists is in a manner the seed of that which will be
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Observe always that everything is the result of change, and get used to thinking that there is nothing nature loves so well as to change existing forms and make new ones like them
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: So does this misfortune prevent you in any way from being just, generous, sober, reasonable, careful, free from error, courteous, free, etc – all of which together make human nature complete?
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Look back over the past, with its changing empires that rose and fell, and you can foresee the future, too
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Acquire the contemplative way of seeing how all things change into one another, and constantly attend to it, and exercise yourself about this part of philosophy. For nothing is so much adapted to produce magnanimity
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: When it comes to all we’re required to go through, we’re equals. No one is more vulnerable than the next man, and no one can be more sure of his surviving to the morrow
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: If any man is able to convince me and show me that I do not think or act right, I will gladly change; for I seek the truth by which no man was ever injured. But he is injured who abides in his error and ignorance
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: "I am unhappy, because this has happened to me." Not so: say, "I am happy, though this has happened to me, because I continue free from pain, neither crushed by the present nor fearing the future"
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: A setback has often cleared the way for greater prosperity. Many things have fallen only to rise to more exalted heights
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Another thing which will help you is to turn your mind to other thoughts and that way get away from your suffering. Call to mind things which you have done that have been upright or courageous; run over in your mind the finest parts you have played
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Don’t be ashamed to need help. Like a soldier storming a wall, you have a mission to accomplish, And if you’ve been wounded and you need a comrade to pull you up? So what?
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: There are times when even to live is an act of bravery
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Throw away your books; stop letting yourself be distracted
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: The best way to avenge yourself is to not be like that
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: At dawn, when you have trouble getting out of bed, tell yourself: "I have to go to work — as a human being, What do I have to complain of, if I’m going to do what I was born for — the things I was brought into the world to do? Or is this what I was created for? To huddle under the blankets and stay warm?"
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Such as are your habitual thoughts, such also will be the character of your mind
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Very little is needed for everything to be upset and ruined, only a slight lapse in reason
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: You always own the option of having no opinion. There is never any need to get worked up or to trouble your soul about things you can’t control. These things are not asking to be judged by you. Leave them alone
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Yes, you can – if you do everything as if it were the last thing you were doing in life, and stop being aimless, stop letting your emotions override what your mind tells you, stop being hypocritical, self-centered, irritable
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: You see how few things you have to do to live a satisfying and reverent life? If you can manage this, that’s all even the gods can ask of you
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Remember to act always as if you were at a symposium. When the food or drink comes around, reach out and take some politely; if it passes you by don’t try pulling it back. And if it has not reached you yet, don’t let your desire run ahead of you, be patient until your turn comes
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Labor willingly and diligently, undistracted and aware of the common interest
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Remember, it is not enough to be hit or insulted to be harmed, you must believe that you are being harmed. If someone succeeds in provoking you, realize that your mind is complicit in the provocation. Take a moment before reacting, and you will find it is easier to maintain control
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: When you have been compelled by circumstances to be disturbed in a manner, quickly return to yourself and do not continue out of tune longer than the compulsion lasts
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: In whatever I do, either by myself or with another, I must direct my energies to this alone, that it shall conduce to the common interest and be in harmony with it
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: The mind that is free from passions is a citadel, for man has nothing more secure to which he can fly for refuge and repel every attack
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: We should discipline ourselves in small things, and from there progress to things of greater value. If you have a headache, practise not cursing. Don’t curse every time you have an earache. And I’m not saying that you can’t complain, only don’t complain with your whole being
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Look not round at the depraved morals of others, but run straight along the line without deviating from it
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: From Maximus I learned self-government, and not to be led aside by anything; and cheerfulness in all circumstances, as well as in illness
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Abstinence, not only from evil deeds, but even from evil thoughts; and further, simplicity in my way of living, far removed from the habits of the rich
life.author: Marcus Aurelius (What Marcus learned from his mother)

life.quote: The recognition that I needed to train and discipline my character
life.author: Marcus Aurelius (What Marcus learned from Rusticus)

life.quote: To read attentively – not to be satisfied with ‘just getting the gist of it’. And not to fall for every smooth talker
life.author: Marcus Aurelius (What Marcus learned from Rusticus)

life.quote: Self-control and resistance to distractions.
life.author: Marcus Aurelius (What Marcus learned from Maximus)

life.quote: Doing your job, without whining
life.author: Marcus Aurelius (What Marcus learned from Maximus)

life.quote: Not to busy myself about trifling things
life.author: Marcus Aurelius (What Marcus learned from Diognetus)

life.quote: The sense he gave of ‘staying’ on the path rather than being ‘kept’ on it
life.author: Marcus Aurelius (What Marcus learned from Maximus)

life.quote: When you’re called upon to speak, then speak, but never about banalities like gladiators, horses, sports, food and drink – common-place stuff. Above all don’t gossip about people, praising, blaming or comparing them
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Drunkenness inflames and lays bare every vice, removing the reserve that acts as a chuck on impulses to wrong behaviour
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: You are composed of three things: body, breath (life), intelligence. Of these the first two are yours insofar as it is your duty to take care of them; but the third alone is truly yours
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Justice will not be observed, if we either care for indifferent things or are easily deceived and careless and changeable
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Do not waste what remains of your life in speculating about your neighbors, unless with a view to some mutual benefit. To wonder what so-and-so is doing and why, or what he is saying, or thinking, or scheming – in a word, anything that distracts you from fidelity to the ruler within you – means a loss of opportunity for some other task
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Turn your desire to stone. Quench your appetites. Keep your mind centered on itself
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Is a world without shameless people possible? No. So this person you’ve just met is one of them. Get over it
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Perfection of character is this: to live each day as if it were your last, without frenzy, without apathy, without pretence
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: The operations of the will are in our power; not in our power are the body, the body’s parts, property, parents, siblings, children, country or friends
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Stick with the situation at hand, and ask, "Why is this so unbearable? Why can’t I endure it?" You’ll be embarrassed to answer
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: It is in our power to have no opinion about a thing and not to be disturbed in our soul; for things themselves have no natural power to form our judgments
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: I see no virtue that is opposed to justice; but I see a virtue that is opposed to love of pleasure, and that is temperance
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Settle on the type of person you want to be and stick to it, whether alone or in company
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: It will even do to socialize with men of good character, in order to model your life on theirs, whether you choose someone living or someone from the past
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Remember, too, on every occasion that leads you to vexation to apply this principle: not that this is a misfortune, but that to bear it nobly is good fortune
life.author: Marcus Aurelius
Marcus Aurelius
life.quote: If you want to be a man of honour and a man of your word, who is going to stop you? You say you don’t want to be obstructed or forced to do something against your will – well, who is going to force you to desire things that you don’t approve, or dislike something against your better judgement?
Consider at what price you sell your integrity; but please, for God’s sake, don’t sell it cheap
life.author: Unknown

life.quote: It is in your power whenever you choose to retire into yourself. For there is no retreat that is quieter or freer from trouble than a man’s own soul
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Be like the promontory against which the waves continually break; but it stands firm and tames the fury of the water around it
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Independence and unvarying reliability, and to pay attention to nothing, no matter how fleetingly, except the logos
life.author: Marcus Aurelius (What Marcus learned from Apollonius)

life.quote: Good morals and the government of my temper
life.author: Marcus Aurelius (What Marcus learned from his grandfather Verus)

life.quote: Compassion. Unwavering adherence to decisions, once he’d reached them. Indifference to superficial honors. Hard work. Persistence
life.author: Marcus Aurelius (What Marcus learned from his adopted father)

life.quote: They saw him for what he was: a man tested by life, accomplished, unswayed by flattery, qualified to govern both himself and them
life.author: Marcus Aurelius (What Marcus learned from his adopted father)

life.quote: That he respected tradition without needing to constantly congratulate himself for safeguarding our traditional values
life.author: Marcus Aurelius (What Marcus learned from his adopted father)

life.quote: To be the same in all circumstances – intense pain, the loss of a child, chronic illness. And to see clearly, from his example, that a man can show both strength and flexility
life.author: Marcus Aurelius (What Marcus learned from Apollonius)

life.quote: Do not let your thoughts at once embrace all the various troubles that you may expect to befall you: but on every occasion ask yourself, "What is there in this that is intolerable and past bearing?" For you will be ashamed to confess
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: If you are pained by any external thing, it is not this thing that disturbs you, but your own judgment about it. And it is in your power to wipe out this judgment now
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Let it make no difference to you whether you are cold or warm, if you are doing your duty; and whether you are drowsy or satisfied with sleep; and whether ill-spoken of or praised; and whether dying or doing something else
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Remember this, that there is a proper dignity and proportion to be observed in the performance of every act of life
life.author: Marcus Aurelius
Marcus Aurelius
life.quote: If then there is an invincible necessity, why do you resist?
Human life. Duration: momentary. Nature: changeable. Perception: dim. Conditions of body: decaying. Soul: spinning around. Fortune: unpredictable. Lasting fame: uncertain
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Yes, keep on degrading yourself, soul. But soon your chance at dignity will be gone. Everyone gets one life. Yours is almost used up, and instead of treating yourself with respect, you have entrusted your own happiness to the souls of others
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: What can guide us? Only philosophy. Which means making sure that the power within stays safe and free from assault, superior to pleasure and pain, doing nothing randomly or dishonestly and with imposture, not dependent on anyone else’s doing something or not doing it
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: The present is all that they can give up, since that is all you have, and what you do not have, you cannot lose
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Do external things distract you? Then make time for yourself to learn something worthwhile; stop letting yourself be pulled in all directions
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Marcus Aurelius: Are you ready to do your duty for Rome? Commodus: Yes, father
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Your faults as a son is my failure as a father
life.author: Marcus Aurelius (To his son Commodus)

life.quote: For 25 years, I have conquered, spilt blood, expanded the empire. Since I became Caesar, I have known four years without war, four years of peace in twenty. And for what? I brought the sword. Nothing more
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Maximus: Caesar, your life… Marcus Aurelius: Please. Please, don’t call me that. Please, come sit. Let us talk together now, very simply, as men. Maximus, talk
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Marcus Aurelius: I want you to become the protector of Rome after I die. I will empower you to one end alone: To give power back to the people of Rome, and end the corruption that has crippled it. Will you accept this great honor I have offered you? Maximus: With all my heart, no
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Marcus Aurelius: You have proven your valor once again, Maximus. Let us hope for the last time. Maximus: There is no one left to fight, sire. Marcus Aurelius: There is always someone left to fight
life.author: Marcus Aurelius
Marcus Aurelius
life.quote: How will the world speak my name in years to come? Will I be known as the philosopher? The warrior? The tyrant…? Or will I be the emperor who gave Rome back her true self?
Time is a sort of river of passing events, and strong is its current; no sooner is a thing brought to sight than it is swept by and another takes its place, and this too will be swept away
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: To be evenminded is the greatest virtue
life.author: Heraclitus

life.quote: Just keep in mind: the more we value things outside our control, the less control we have
life.author: Epictetus

life.quote: The tranquility that comes when you stop caring what they say. Or think, or do. Only what you do
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: The whole future lies in uncertainty: live immediately
life.author: Seneca

life.quote: It does not matter what you bear, but how you bear it
life.author: Seneca

life.quote: A gem cannot be polished without friction, nor a man perfected without trials
life.author: Seneca

life.quote: He has the most who is content with the least
life.author: Diogenes

life.quote: Self-control is strength. Right thought is mastery. Calmness is power
life.author: James Allen

life.quote: Man conquers the world by conquering himself
life.author: Zeno of Citium

life.quote: Be stoic: Just do the right thing. Just keep going
life.author: Maxime Lagacé

life.quote: Success is based off of your willingness to work your ass off no matter what obstacles are in your way
life.author: David Goggins

life.quote: The ultimate power in life is to be completely self-reliant, completely yourself
life.author: Robert Greene

life.quote: To be stoic is not to be emotionless, but to remain unaffected by your emotions
life.author: James Pierce

life.quote: Learn to be indifferent to what makes no difference
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: To bear trials with a calm mind robs misfortune of its strength and burden
life.author: Seneca

life.quote: The willing are led by fate, the reluctant dragged
life.author: Cleanthes

life.quote: Too many people believe that everything must be pleasurable in life
life.author: Robert Greene

life.quote: A rational person can find peace by cultivating indifference to things outside of their control
life.author: Naval Ravikant

life.quote: If you are easily provoked you are easily controlled
life.author: Unknown

life.quote: Be an island of calm in the sea of craziness
life.author: Unknown

life.quote: Relentlessly prune bullshit, don’t wait to do things that matter, and savor the time you have
life.author: Paul Graham

life.quote: The more you seek the uncomfortable, the more you will become comfortable
life.author: Conor McGregor

life.quote: Failure and deprivation are the best educators and purifiers
life.author: Albert Einstein

life.quote: Between stimulus and response, there is a space. In that space is our power to choose our response
life.author: Viktor Frankl

life.quote: The mind that is anxious about future events is miserable
life.author: Seneca

life.quote: To make a goal of comfort or happiness has never appealed to me; a system of ethics built on this basis would be sufficient only for a herd of cattle
life.author: Albert Einstein

life.quote: If you make happiness your goal, you’ll be disappointed. If you make presence your goal, you’ll be satisfied
life.author: Maxime Lagacé

life.quote: If it’s endurable, then endure it. Stop complaining
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: That one wants nothing to be different, not forward, not backwards, not in all eternity. Not merely bear what is necessary, still less conceal it… but love it
life.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

life.quote: That’s what Stoicism is all about: learning to live a good life by developing peace of mind through confidence of one’s ability to overcome adversity
life.author: The Daily Stoic: 366 Meditations on Wisdom, Perseverance, and the Art of Living (Amazon book)

life.quote: The wise man is neither raised up by prosperity nor cast down by adversity; for always he has striven to rely predominantly on himself, and to derive all joy from himself
life.author: Seneca

life.quote: The great law of nature is that it never stops. There is no end
life.author: Ryan Holiday

life.quote: Don’t explain your philosophy. Embody it
life.author: Epictetus

life.quote: I love to go and see all the things I am happy without
life.author: Socrates (On going to the market)

life.quote: The robbed that smiles steals something from the thief
life.author: Othello

life.quote: Stoicism is about the domestication of emotions, not their elimination
life.author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

life.quote: A Stoic is someone who transforms fear into prudence, pain into transformation, mistakes into initiation, and desire into undertaking
life.author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

life.quote: Stoicism teaches how to keep a calm and rational mind no matter what happens to you and it helps you understand and focus on what you can control and not worry about and accept what you can’t control
life.author: Jonas Salzgeber

life.quote: Stoicism, understood properly, is a cure for a disease. The disease in question is the anxiety, grief, fear, and various other negative emotions that plague humans and prevent them from experiencing a joyful existence. William B
life.author: Irvine

life.quote: Sometimes life hits you in the head with a brick. Don’t lose faith
life.author: Steve Jobs

life.quote: Waste no more time arguing what a good man should be, be one
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: The true hero is one who conquers his own anger and hatred
life.author: Dalai Lama

life.quote: The art of being wise is the art of knowing what to overlook
life.author: William James

life.quote: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants
life.author: Epictetus

life.quote: He is a wise man who does not grieve for the things which he has not, but rejoices for those which he has
life.author: Epictetus

life.quote: What you’re supposed to do when you don’t like a thing is change it. If you can’t change it, change the way you think about it. Don’t complain
life.author: Maya Angelou

life.quote: You have power over your mind — not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength
life.author: Marcus Aurelius

life.quote: Everything can be taken from a man but one thing: the last of the human freedoms – to choose one’s attitude in any given set of circumstances, to choose one’s own way
life.author: Viktor Frankl (Man’s Search for Meaning, Amazon book)

life.quote: Many men will meet me who are drunkards, lustful, ungrateful, greedy, and excited by the frenzy of ambition
life.author: Seneca

life.quote: Set aside a certain number of days during which you shall be content with the scantiest and cheapest fare, with coarse and rough dress, saying to yourself the while, "Is this the condition that I feared?"
life.author: Seneca

life.quote: It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor
life.author: Seneca

life.quote: ‎Life is a shipwreck, but we must not forget to sing in the lifeboats
life.author: Voltaire

life.quote: What we fear doing most is usually what we most need to do
life.author: Tim Ferriss

life.quote: The things you own end up owning you
life.author: Joshua Fields Millburn (The Minimalists)

life.quote: Is there such a thing as a cheerful pessimist? That’s what I am
life.author: Charlie Munger

life.quote: It is not daily increase but daily decrease, hack away the unessential. The closer to the source, the less wastage there is
life.author: Bruce Lee
